programme.title: Star Trek: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Worf is excited when his son Alexander reaches the age for the first Rite of Ascension, the ceremony in which Klingons declare their intention to become warriors. However, it soon transpires that the boy is not enthusiastic about the forthcoming event. Patrick Stewart stars

programme.desc: A series of environmental disasters leaves Earth almost entirely flooded, with the surviving humans crammed into overpopulated cities on the few remaining areas of land. programme.desc: Victorian scientists on a marine expedition discover an extensive prehistoric city at the bottom of the ocean - and the existence of a terrifying host of underwater monsters. Sci-fi adventure, starring Doug McClure, Peter Gilmore, Shane Rimmer, Lea Brodie and Cyd Charisse

programme.title: Star Trek
programme.desc: Kirk ignores an alien buoy warning the Enterprise that it is trespassing into hostile space, and ends up sentenced to death on a hostile planet where he is forced to take part in an OK Corral-style gunfight. Classic sci-fi adventure, starring William Shatner, Leonard Nimoy and DeForest Kelley

programme.title: Star Trek: The Next Generation
programme.desc: A Ferengi whose child Picard killed in battle several years previously, reveals he plans to avenge the death by murdering the Enterprise captain's son. The team is faced with locating and protecting the boy - a task which proves more difficult when he contracts a mystery illness. Patrick Stewart stars

programme.title: UFO
programme.desc: Straker and Freeman stare death in the face as they try to track down a killer who can apparently read their every thought. Gerry Anderson's sci-fi drama, starring Ed Bishop and George Sewell

programme.title: Walker, Texas Ranger
programme.desc: A group of citizens frustrated by the judicial system take the law into their own hands and set about killing all the bad guys in town

programme.title: Mercenaries (2011)
programme.desc: A former SAS commando leaves the British army to become a soldier for hire, operating out of the Balkans. He is recruited by the US authorities for a top-secret rescue mission when their ambassador to Serbia is taken hostage by a former general and wanted war criminal during a coup. Action adventure, with Robert Fucilla and Billy Zane

programme.title: Reasonable Doubt (2014)
programme.desc: District attorney Mitch Brockden is involved in a fatal hit-and-run incident, and a convicted felon is charged with his crime. Mitch's guilt drives him to throw out the case when it comes to trial - but when the accused later goes on a killing spree, he feels compelled to bring him to justice personally. Crime thriller, starring Dominic Cooper and Samuel L Jackson

programme.title: Saturn 3 (1980)
programme.desc: A deranged killer steals an experimental robot and assumes the identity of a new recruit at an isolated research station on one of Saturn's moons. As he sets about teaching the machine to think for itself, it takes on some of his darker impulses and turns on the two human scientists running the base. Martin Amis-scripted sci-fi thriller, starring Kirk Douglas, Harvey Keitel and Farrah Fawcett

programme.title: Countess Dracula (1971)
programme.desc: A Hungarian countess discovers bathing in the blood of virgins is the secret of eternal youth, and demands her lover bring her a steady stream of victims. However, her affair with another man turns him against her, while the spate of disappearing young women arouses suspicion. Hammer horror, starring Ingrid Pitt, Nigel Green and Lesley-Anne Down

Mystery, starring Christopher Plummer, James Mason, Donald Sutherland, John Gielgud and Genevieve Bujold

Supernatural thriller based on a short story by Tim Lebbon, starring Nicolas Cage and Sarah Wayne Callies

programme.desc: Mismatched lovers Penny and Vince are due to get married. The last-ever episode of John Sullivan's romantic comedy, starring Paul Nicholas and Jan Francis

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Smiler finds himself pursued by a wanton gold-digger who thinks he's rich, but luckily Truly is full of ideas to solve the problem. Stephen Lewis and Frank Thornton star

programme.title: Shakespeare & Hathaway: Private Investigators
programme.desc: Tracking a local conman, Frank and Lu make some unlikely allies when they encounter a pair of deadly gangsters. Mark Benton and Jo Joyner star in the comedy drama about an oddball couple of private detectives who investigate crime in Stratford-upon-Avon

programme.title: Shakespeare & Hathaway: Private Investigators
programme.desc: When the duo are hired to help close down an old bingo hall, Frank is surprised to find an old enemy at work - but what is he really up to? Guest starring Jim Moir, aka Vic Reeves, with Mark Benton and Jo Joyner

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Ted leads an investigation into the apparent suicide of a city trader who was embroiled in the cut-throat world of London's financial district in the 1980s. As the team delve deeper into the macho fraternity of 'The Wolfpack', they find a darker side to the debauchery, secret hand signals and all-nighters that bonded the traders together - including a strict hierarchy that might be worth killing for. Meanwhile, Steve tries to learn some tricks of the trade, amid his own financial crisis. Detective drama, starring Larry Lamb

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The team is approached by a group of survivors from a recent train crash, who want the members to uncover the reasons for the disaster. In the process investigators stumble upon another mystery, when one of the bodies pulled from the wreckage remains unidentified. With Emilia Fox, William Gaminara, Tom Ward, Amita Dhiri and Emma Cunniffe

programme.title: Gentleman Jack
programme.desc: Anne Lister journeys north to Denmark while acting as chaperone to an aristocratic young woman, and finds herself embraced in the royal court. Despite her joyous new life, she remains haunted by her estrangement from her lost love. When bad news reaches her, she faces the prospect of returning to confront the past. Ann Walker makes a bold resolution about her future, while an unexpected visitor threatens to finally expose Thomas Sowden's macabre secret. Sofie Grabol (The Killing) guest stars as the queen of Denmark

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Crafty con Fletcher helps new inmate Godber settle in by giving him a few lessons on coping with prison life. First episode of the classic comedy, originally broadcast in 1974, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Barry and Glenda get a shock when a man they foolishly exchanged addresses with on holiday turns up on their doorstep. To make a strained situation worse, it appears their guest has an unusual hobby

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Alvin tries to persuade Nora Batty to go for a ride in his sidecar, but she's having none of it. When she relates the story of her long-standing feud with Audrey Craig - who had the audacity to laugh at her hat during a wedding many years ago - it becomes clear the broom-brandishing battleaxe is not one to be messed with

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The Kembleford Ramblers' annual outing takes a tragic turn when the local lord is found strangled, so the cleric gets his walking boots on to solve the crime. Murder mystery, starring Mark Williams

programme.title: Sister Boniface Mysteries
programme.desc: Sister Boniface investigates a coven of witches when a human sacrifice is discovered in the woods

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: With Sasha back on fighting form, UCOS investigates the death of a talented cricket prodigy, who was the apple of his father's eye, yet loathed by his on-field team-mates. The death was recorded as misadventure but with new evidence pointing to infighting, over-zealous autograph hunters and extra marital affairs, UCOS are soon bowled over by the list of potential murder suspects. Meanwhile, wise to Steve's monetary problems, Danny appoints himself as his personal financial adviser. Detective drama, starring Larry Lamb

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode of the crime drama. Leo receives devastating news from home - his wife and daughter have been involved in a hit-and-run accident, prompting him to set off for Sheffield immediately. Meanwhile, Nikki is called out to the river when the bodies of two unidentified women are discovered, both shot execution-style. William Gaminara, Tom Ward and Emilia Fox star

programme.title: Hattie
programme.desc: Ruth Jones stars as Carry On actress Hattie Jacques in this dramatisation of her secret affair with a younger man in the early 1960s, while still married to actor John Le Mesurier. A love triangle develops between the three and Hattie uses her charm and ingenuity to control escalating family tensions and threats of public exposure - but must ultimately make a decision that puts her at risk of being left on her own. Also starring Robert Bathurst, Aidan Turner and Jeany Spark

programme.title: Born and Bred
programme.desc: Part one of two. Tom and Deborah head off for a well-earned holiday, but their hopes of getting away from it all are dashed when they realise that Len and Linda are staying at a campsite nearby. Back in Ormston, Arthur is unexpectedly called away from his duties in the village, and the impending hospital visit by fiery local councillor Eugenia Maddox (guest star Frances de la Tour) prompts the residents to rally round to make a good impression

programme.title: Born and Bred
programme.desc: Part two of two. Ormston is engulfed by a political dispute when Tory councillor Eugenia Maddox returns to the village, armed with a plan for election, but opposition surfaces from an unexpected source. Meanwhile, Tom admits to Deborah he does not think his father is up to the job any more, but when someone close to home collapses, it is Arthur who is called upon to operate

programme.title: Born and Bred
programme.desc: Festive episode of the drama set in the Lancashire village of Ormston. Arthur gets into the yuletide spirit by playing pranks on son Tom, who is singularly unimpressed, while Deborah looks forward to the fresh start afforded by the new year, after the trauma of losing her baby. On a lighter note, news breaks that Santa and an elf have been on a crime spree, so local bobby Len and station-master Wilf set out to capture the dastardly duo, and decide the best way is to don disguise. After raiding Phyllis and Linda's wardrobes, the pair end up looking like Cinderella's ugly sisters. James Bolam, Michael French and Jenna Russell star, with John Henshaw, Peter Gunn, Maggie Steed and Naomi Radcliffe, plus guest appearances by Una Stubbs and Stephanie Cole

programme.title: Howards' Way
programme.desc: Maritime drama with the Howard family, starring Maurice Colbourne and Jan Harvey

programme.title: Howards' Way
programme.desc: Jack is certain that Tom will invest in the Mermaid boat yard

programme.title: Pie in the Sky
programme.desc: Fisher comes under suspicion following a tragic accident during a pheasant shoot on a country estate, and asks Crabbe to investigate the case. Starring Richard Griffiths, Malcolm Sinclair and Ingrid Lacey

programme.title: Pie in the Sky
programme.desc: A wealthy Irishwoman descends on the restaurant with her new husband in tow who turns out to be a figure from Margaret's wild past in swinging 1960s London. Crime drama, starring Richard Griffiths, Maggie Steed and Nigel Terry

programme.title: Pie in the Sky
programme.desc: Crabbe comes to the rescue when a regular customer is hounded by the police, but the sleuthing chef finds himself caught up in a long-running feud between notorious villain Razor Reg Costigan and his arch-rival Striker of the Yard. Offbeat drama, guest starring Nicholas Ball

programme.title: Inspector George Gently
programme.desc: It's Christmas Eve 1969 and Gently is enjoying a spot of festive cheer until he gets the news that a bank has been hit by armed robbers and he and Bacchus have work to do. The detective's hunt for the gunmen takes him into the world of skinheads and he is later faced with a dilemma. Does the law always have to be so cruel, or can he bend it just this once? Detective drama set in the north-east of England, starring Martin Shaw and Lee Ingleby, with a guest appearance by Jody Latham (Shameless)

programme.title: The Brokenwood Mysteries
programme.desc: The Frog and Cheetah's publican Ray Neilson branches out into tourism with a Lord of the Rings-themed attraction. Shortly afterwards his wife is discovered dead under a giant foam spider, apparently killed by an improbably powerful dose of poison from New Zealand's only native venomous spider. Suspicion soon falls on Ray and local arachnologist Chandra Singh

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: When Lady Felicia's home comes under threat, Father Brown is forced to seek help from an unlikely ally. Mark Williams and Nancy Carroll star

programme.title: Rebellion
programme.desc: The siege enters its third day, and the rebels try to get governments of other nations to recognise Irish independence. However, the British forces are closing in on them. Elizabeth, Frances and Jimmy get caught up in the fighting at the GPO

programme.title: The Split
programme.desc: Leading divorce lawyer, Hannah Stern, finds business is personal when she leaves the family firm for rivals Noble & Hale, and finally faces her father who walked out 30 years ago. Abi Morgan's drama, starring Nicola Walker and Stephen Mangan

programme.title: Miss Marple
programme.desc: Feature-length episode of the detective drama. Agatha Christie's elderly sleuth is intrigued by the case of a businessman who died in his 'counting house' with a pocketful of rye - and as she sets out to crack the 'crime by rhyme', suspicion soon falls on the household and staff at Yew Tree Lodge. Joan Hickson, Timothy West, Peter Davison, Tom Wilkinson, Stacy Dorning, Clive Merrison and Rachel Bell star

programme.title: Rebus

programme.desc: Caernarfon-based artist Steve 'Pablo' Jones packs a bag and heads to Covent Garden in London, to St Paul's Church to meet his muse, singer and presenter Aled Jones. Though Aled and Steve do seem like the odd couple, they hit it off straight away and were soon lost in conversation like a couple of old friends. Aled feels able to open up about the time when he lost the love for singing, and Steve hopes to be able to capture a sense of that vulnerability when it comes to the final portrait

programme.title: Dirty Rotten Scammers
programme.desc: Care worker Peter lost out on 3,000 when scammers convinced him they were from his bank's fraud team. Jim Browning is the scourge of the scammers working with the police to get them arrested. Presented by Michelle and Mavis Ackerley

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: In Dewsbury, West Yorkshire, a midwife and her builder husband buy a house which hasn't been lived in for a decade. However, they have big plans to create their forever home for them and their four children. Plus, two houses in Worksop, Nottinghamshire, and Wakefield, West Yorkshire are bought at auction by developers who plan to rent them out. Presenters including Martin Roberts, Dion Dublin and Martel Maxwell follow the fortunes of new new owners as they bring their plans to fruition

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Richard Madley and Kate Bliss help two teams look for items at the International Antiques Fair of Wales in Builth Wells, Powys. Charlie Ross visits the National Fencing Musuem

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Doctors

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Jacqui Joseph finds a drop-leaf table, a pair of legless dining chairs and a collection of unwanted curtains at High Wycombe recycling centre for her and the team to upcycle

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin helps a retired couple who want to reconnect with their Scottish roots in Ayrshire. They have a budget of 500,000 and a view over water is a priority. Away from the search, Jonnie also learns about an ancient technique to create salt using sea water and an impressive tower of blackthorn branches

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Lee Burkhill and Chris Hull head to Nottingham, where they meet retired couple Jennifer and Alfred. Having had building work done on their downsized home, their garden has been left looking like a builder's yard with rubble, large concrete pads and a gigantic, ugly shed. Jennifer would love a garden to relax and read in the sun and Alfred would like a dedicated spot for his barbecue, where he can prepare meals with his grandchildren. Both love the modern, clean lines Mediterranean look and would to incorporate some olive trees. Lee and Chris set out to meet their wishes with a healthy 6,500 budget at their disposal

programme.title: Clean It, Fix It
programme.desc: The team arrives in Kent to help solve a family-of-four's housing woes. They have just 24 hours and a limited budget to fix an unfinished kitchen extension with bare plaster work. The kitchen is addressed as part of a bid to redesign the utility space to make their dream home a reality.

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Stephen Mangan joins Alexander Armstrong to co-host the quiz, in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the most obscure answers

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Roman Kemp presents the live magazine show featuring a mixture of celebrity chat and stories of interest

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Vinny gives Suki an ultimatum and Stacey worries about Lily when Amy tells her about the older man who bought her trainers. Tensions are high at Elaine's girly pamper day and Rocky tries to help Kathy get the guests she wants at her wedding

programme.title: A Wright Family Holiday
programme.desc: Mark Wright, his brother Josh and father Mark Sr head to Skegness, Lincolnshire. After enjoying the resort's pier and funfair, the trio hit the beach. Over a meal of fish and chips, they reminisce about the family holidays of Josh and Mark's childhood. Next, the trio take to the water on jet skis. Family joker Mark can't resist soaking his dad, but an angry Mark Sr gets his revenge. As the sun sets, an emotional Mark opens up to his comnpanions, admitting an obsession with work isolated him from his family, changed him as a person and almost pushed him to the edge

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Charlie Dimmock and Lee Burkhill head to Chorlton, Greater Manchester, where they come up with designs for a garden that will remind owners Louise and Steve of their wedding in New Orleans. The couple's garden already has some mature plants that the designers are keen to incorporate to full effect, plus they already have an attractive pond that they'd like the duo to expand without disturbing its current inhabitants. Charlie and Lee try to bring the US to the north-west on a budget of 4,000

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc: Adventurer Bear Grylls traces his ancestry, starting by exploring his paternal army-serving grandfather Ted Grylls' old trunk, intriguingly full of documents marked 'Top Secret'. Next, Bear wants finds out more about the life of his beloved grandad Neville. His father - Bear's great grandfather - is revealed to be a loving family man and progressive headmaster who modernised Harrow School. Bear eventually traces the family line back several centuries revealing, to his delight, Scottish ancestry. A trip to north of the border uncovers the story of Bear's 10-X great grandfather, the Duke of Argyll

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the topical debate from Deeside, Wales, inviting a panel of politicians and other guests to answer questions from an invited audience on subjects that have made the headlines over the past week

programme.title: Newscast
programme.desc: Light-hearted discussion of the week's political events

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: Claimed and Shamed
programme.desc: Naga Munchetty revisits more shocking stories from the archive, including the American ex-wife - the beneficiary of a life insurance policy - who sought deadly revenge after a bitter divorce. Plus, the conman who blatantly fabricated his bogus damage claim by crashing his own car in broad daylight

programme.title: Dirty Rotten Scammers
programme.desc: Tip and advice are offered to a man who is worried his elderly father may be susceptible to scammers. Presented by Michelle and Mavis Ackerley

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Tommy Walsh visits two detached bungalows, one in Mexborough, South Yorkshire, the other in Orpington, London. Martel Maxwell is in the Cumbria village of Greengill to see a house set on several acres of land

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Christina Trevanion presides as two teams shop for antiques in Nottinghamshire, with experts Raj Bisram and Roo Irvine offering the contenders sage advice. Christina also meets a world record-holding collector of tea towels

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The clerical sleuth must delve into the past and open up old wounds when a child killer is found murdered. Crime drama, with a guest appearance by John Thomson

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Jay Blades is at Walsall Recycling Centre in search of two items headed for the skip that he can rework and repurpose to reveal their true potential. Bristol-based upholsterer Leigh-Anne Treadwell attempts to give a set of mid-century chairs a style overhaul. For his own project, Jay has two tables to transform

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Sonali Shah helps a soon-to-be retired vicar and her husband on their search for a new home in the countryside of Gloucestershire. She also visits Adam Henson of Countryfile fame at his farm dedicated to the conservation of some of the rarest livestock breeds in the world

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: In Telford, Shropshire, Charlie Dimmock and Chris Hull set out to design a cat friendly 'enchanted' garden. Lesley would love an enchanted space suitable for her beloved cat Gizmo to share with her, and importantly, her very own outdoor gin bar to relax with her friends. She has 3,500 to spare, hoping Charlie and Chris can make her dreams come true.

programme.title: Clean It, Fix It
programme.desc: The team is in Bedford to help a family-of-six bursting at the seams. They have just 24 hours and a limited budget to turn a dining room into a much-needed bedroom. The helpers also create an area for the family to eat, transforming an old utility space into a breakfast bar

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong hosts the quiz in which contestants try to record the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Lauren Laverne reveals the correct answers and comments on the players' scores

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Roman Kemp round off the working week with a mixture of celebrity chat and stories of interest

programme.title: Our Lives
programme.desc: The story of keen sailor Natasha Lambert, who has cerebral palsy. Natasha cannot use her arms or legs, so her father invented a system that would enable her to control a boat by breathing in and out of a straw. First, she sailed the Solent and then traversed the English Channel. Each time her challenges got bigger and bigger. Now, Natasha wants to control a 46-ft yacht across the Atlantic. This documentary charts a family determined to enable Natasha to fulfil her dream, illustrating how her ambition has inspired all of them

programme.title: Question of Sport
programme.desc: With former rugby union star James Haskell, ex-England bowler Ryan Sidebottom, 4x100m relay world champion Nethaneel Mitchell-Blake and European weightlifting gold medallist Emily Campbell join team captains Ugo Monye and Sam Quek and host Paddy McGuinness on the quiz

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Comedians Jo Brand and Joe Wilkinson, weather presenter Lucy Martin and journalist Amol Rajan join host Rob Brydon and regular captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the offbeat panel show. As usual, the participants set out to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible fibs about themselves in a bid to secure a team victory, through rounds such as Home Truths and Quick-fire Lies

programme.title: Have I Got News for You
programme.desc: BBC News reporter Clive Myrie guest hosts, with actor Munya Chawawa and journalist Helen Lewis joining team captains Paul Merton and Ian Hislop to delve into the comedic side of recent headline stories

programme.title: Queen of Oz
programme.desc: Comedy about the black sheep of a fictional British royal family, Princess Georgiana. On the back of her latest scandal her father, the King, makes the unprecedented move of abdicating his Australian throne in favour of her, hoping that sending her 10,000 miles away from London will give Georgiana some real responsibility and finally be the making of her. A welcome reception is Georgie's first public appearance Down Under, where an offensive faux pas from the jet-lagged new Queen makes the night go from bad to worse. Comedy, starring Catherine Tate

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: The Chris & Rosie Ramsey Show
programme.desc: The hosts are joined by comedian Katherine Ryan and her husband Bobby Kootstra, who discuss rekindling their relationship after spending decades apart. Features include Please Keep Me Anonymous, where a well-known face reads out some terrifying audience confessions and It Goes or I Go, where audience members compete to rid themselves of something their loved one refuses to remove from the house

programme.title: Bump
programme.desc: Bowie is babysitting and Vince is in crisis, but Reema is there to help him through it. Keeks is keen to take the next step with Santi, and Oly is thinking about her future with Michael. Bowie, looking for love in all the wrong places, joins Dom on his first mandate with Tim at a microbrewery, where he spills the beans on the inspiration behind his dad's friend-finding app. Later, an awkward run-in with Angie and Edith results in the talk Dom and Angie had been putting off. Santi and Oly join Skye and Madison and Karl and Austin at the school parents' 1980s trivia night fundraiser, where they get a solid lesson in how not to grow up. Bowie gets unexpectedly lucky at last, but things go very wrong for him. Australian drama, starring Nathalie Morris

programme.title: Bump
programme.desc: Oly makes an important declaration, but she's blindsided with an outcome she wasn't hoping for. Santi and Oly face an emotional reckoning when a frightening crisis forces them to confront what really matters. Vince and Reema's relationship finally crosses a threshold, as Ariel's birth preparations push them together. Zac brings Talia back to the fold, and things get real for Ariel, Talia and Vince as Ariel goes into labour - life will never be the same again. The birth of their baby pushes some long hidden truths into the open. Hector's bonding with Gabe looks like good news for Rosa, until Gabe takes things too far. A loved-up Bowie has a chilling omen for Angie and Edith. Australian drama, starring Nathalie Morris

programme.title: David Brent: Life on the Road (2016)
programme.desc: More than a decade on from his appearance in documentary series The Office, a film crew is once again following the life of David Brent. He is now working as a rep for a cleaning-goods distributor, but harbours dreams of making it big in the music business. Acting on this, he takes three weeks off work and tours with a new-look version of Foregone Conclusion, the band he fronted in the 1990s. Comedy, directed by and starring Ricky Gervais

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Live
programme.desc: Anna Haugh is joined by chefs Chantelle Nicholson and Theo Randall, plus special guest Stacey Dooley. Olly Smith picks the wines to go with the studio dishes

programme.title: Trooping the Colour: The King's Birthday Parade
programme.desc: Huw Edwards introduces live coverage of King Charles III's first official birthday parade. From the heart of London, the Welsh Guards troop their colour on Horse Guards Parade in a world-renowned spectacle full of music, majesty and military precision. The morning's events culminate with the annual RAF fly-past and the royal family's iconic balcony appearance. JJ Chalmers speaks live to those associated with this remarkable day

programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.desc: Eric Knowles is at the helm with experts Danny Sebastian and Caroline Hawley, as two teams scour the antiques centre in the hope that they can make the greater profit at auction. There are plenty of highs and lows in the saleroom, while Eric also gets the chance to meet an unlikely war hero

programme.title: Live Challenge Cup Rugby League
programme.desc: Hull FC v St Helens (Kick-off 2.30pm). All the action from the quarter-final at MKM Stadium. Hull have struggled for consistency in the Super League this season, but claimed a convincing 32-8 victory away to Castleford Tigers in the previous round. The Saints won 26-6 at Championship side Halifax Panthers last time out and have also been below their best at times so far this term

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Charlie and the Rich brother's face one of their hardest ever garden rescues to date in Stowmarket, turning a concrete space into a family friendly back garden

programme.title: The Hit List
programme.desc: Marvin and Rochelle Humes present a celebrity edition of the music-based quiz show. Food critic Jay Rayner and baker John Whaite, Steps stars Faye Tozer and Ian 'H' Watkins, and comedians Jayde Adams and Babatunde Alsh must name as many hit songs and artists as possible, with a 10,000 jackpot for their chosen charity up for grabs

programme.title: Michael McIntyre's The Wheel
programme.desc: The comedian hosts the Saturday-night gameshow, in which contestants take on a colossal spinning wheel and answer questions in the hope of securing a cash prize. Tonight's expert celebrity advice comes from Chris Moyles on breakfast radio, Clare Balding on Wimbledon, Josh Widdicombe on Neighbours, Yung Filly on YouTube, Frankie Bridge on girl groups, Owain Wyn Evans on weather and Rustie Lee on food

programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman present a star-studded version of the general knowledge quiz. programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Jan's actions have a disastrous impact on her personal life as she and Iain deal with a road accident involving a vehicle transporting a heart for an urgent transplant. Jodie takes Max's advice following a hard day, possibly against her better judgement, and Jacob becomes insecure when Sah comments on his age

programme.title: Annika
programme.desc: The DI and her team are tasked with solving the murder of a man who was thrown in the river from a party boat - an investigation made all the more difficult by the fact that everyone supposedly loved the victim

programme.title: Annika
programme.desc: A young woman murdered on the Glasgow docks hits the officers hard when Michael's brother is named as the next of kin. As the team investigates, Michael is taken off the case

programme.title: The Deer Hunter (1978)
programme.desc: The lives of three American steelworkers and their families are torn apart in the wake of the Vietnam War. After enduring horrific treatment in a prison camp during the conflict, the three friends return to their homes but struggle to readjust to normal life. Oscar-winning drama, starring Robert De Niro, Christopher Walken, Meryl Streep, John Savage and John Cazale in his last film role

programme.title: Clean It, Fix It
programme.desc: After spending all their money buying their first house together, Rory and Holly have no cash left. The team have 24 hours and a minimal budget to transform their home

programme.title: Great Coastal Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo returns to travel by train to more places around the British Isles, beginning by heading to the self-governing Isle of Man - a paradise for rail lovers. His first stop on the Manx Electric Railway is the capital of Douglas, where he reveals the island's parliament the Tynwald is older than Westminster, before the Isle of Man Steam Railway takes him down the east coast to Castletown, from where he heads to the Norse Castle Rusheword

programme.title: Caught Red Handed
programme.desc: A criminal couple use an unusual technique to con people at cashpoints. A would-be robber with a knife underestimates an older female cashier, and a bragging joyrider ends up crashing back down to earth. Presented by Dominic Littlewood

programme.desc: Calls on the day's talking points, with views and experiences from across the UK. Call 08085 909693 (calls are free from mobiles and landlines)

programme.desc: Rick Edwards hosts the quiz in which contestants compete for the chance to win 10,000, with a single 'impossible' answer knocking them out for the day

programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers' Bakeation
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers travel through France, where they make tarte aux pralines, a savoury-stuffed brioche, apricot tarte Tatin and, of course, the traditional French baguette

programme.title: Home Is Where the Art Is
programme.desc: Three artists travel to Leicestershire to pitch ideas to celebrate the buyers' dog. But only two will go on to realise their artworks, before the buyers choose their favourite

programme.title: Animals at Play
programme.desc: Part one of two. The reasons why young animals enjoy playing, and how it can teach them to survive in the wild. The programme explores how young elephants, which rarely leave their mothers' side for the first eight years of life, play to develop social skills, while macaques hone their mental agility by playing games with stones. Plus, a zoologist who looks after orphaned cheetahs reveals how play can help cubs learn to hunt

programme.title: Murder, Mystery and My Family: Case Closed?
programme.desc: Sasha Wass and Jeremy Dein revisit their investigation into a case of murder and mistaken identity, when a woman's body was found among the sand dunes of Great Yarmouth in 1900

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Interesting finds from the show's travels around the country, including a late-19th-century Steiff cow on rollers and a joystick from a First World War aeroplane

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Jessie Cave, Ayesha Hazarika, Simon Hickson and AJ Pritchard keep their eyes on the prize ahead of Friday's final, while Richard Osman asks the questions

programme.title: Great Coastal Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo's journey has brought him to Lee on the Solent in Hampshire and the training centre for the coastguard. He also visits the great maritime city of Portsmouth, and then travels eastwards to Chichester's vast, natural harbour

programme.title: How to Win the Ashes
programme.desc: A look at what it takes to lift the most famous trophy in cricket, featuring stories from the most memorable clashes between England and Australia. Through interviews with cricket stars including Ben Stokes, Jimmy Anderson and Glenn McGrath, this documentary examines the on-field heroics that captured a nation's imagination, and lifts the lid on the behind-the-scenes turmoil, revealing a darker side to the pursuit of success

programme.title: Springwatch
programme.desc: All eyes are on the nests at RSPB Arne in Dorset. Will they fledge before the night is over? Chris Packham and Michaela Strachan look back over the series to see who the main cast of characters have been. Megan McCubbin continues to explore the peripheries of the reserve, and looks at some of its more intriguing inhabitants

programme.title: Scandalous: Phone Hacking on Trial
programme.desc: A look at the bitter legal battle taking place for a decade over allegations of unlawful information gathering at some of Britain's biggest newspaper groups. Told through the testimonies of alleged victims who claim they were targeted unlawfully by the papers, including Sienna Miller, Hugh Grant, Steve Coogan, Heather Mills, Shobna Gulati and Simon Hughes, as well as private individuals who were caught up in the news, this documentary examines the evidence

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: The day's important national and international news stories with Victoria Derbyshire

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Glastonbury 2019
programme.desc: Memorable performances from Worthy Farm in Somerset, where artists including Stormzy, George Ezra, Bastille, Sheryl Crow, the Killers, Liam Gallagher, Janet Jackson, the Proclaimers, Kylie Minogue and Miley Cyrus entertained the enthusiastic crowds across the three days of the festival

programme.title: Dr Xand's Con or Cure
programme.desc: A campaign to warn of birth defects in babies whose mothers take the epilepsy drug sodium valproate while pregnant. Plus, fake medicines being touted as 'cures' for autism

programme.title: Springwatch
programme.desc: Chris Packham and Michaela Strachan have overnight news of the key characters being followed in this year's show. Gillian Burke continues her exploration of Snowdonia, looking for the UK's only venomous snake, the adder. Plus, the 81-year-old who has dedicated a decade to building boxes for swifts

programme.title: Springwatch
programme.desc: The nests are proving as exciting as ever and Chris Packham and Michaela Strachan indulge viewers with the highlights ahead of the weekend. Gillian Burke travels further north within Snowdonia's National Park to meet a pine marten soon to be released into the wild

programme.desc: In-depth current affairs report covering a story behind the headlines

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Lee Burkhill and Chris Hull head to Nottingham, where they meet retired couple Jennifer and Alfred. Having had building work done on their downsized home, their garden has been left looking like a builder's yard with rubble, large concrete pads and a gigantic, ugly shed. Jennifer would love a garden to relax and read in the sun and Alfred would like a dedicated spot for his barbecue, where he can prepare meals with his grandchildren. Both love the modern, clean lines Mediterranean look and would to incorporate some olive trees. Lee and Chris set out to meet their wishes with a healthy 6,500 budget at their disposal

programme.title: Clean It, Fix It
programme.desc: The team arrives in Kent to help solve a family-of-four's housing woes. They have just 24 hours and a limited budget to fix an unfinished kitchen extension with bare plaster work. The kitchen is addressed as part of a bid to redesign the utility space to make their dream home a reality.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don plants tropical gingers and tomatoes and direct sowing beans, and Rekha Mistry's shares the secrets of her success for growing aubergines on her London allotment. Elsewhere, Joe Swift visits a stunning walled garden in Denbighshire, designed and planted by owners who love to recycle and repurpose as much as they can, and journalist Rosie Kinchen discusses how horticulture helped her deal with postnatal depression

programme.title: Nicky Campbell
programme.desc: Calls on the day's talking points, with views and experiences from across the UK. Call 08085 909693 (calls are free from mobiles and landlines)

programme.desc: The latest stories from Westminster and beyond

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Rick Edwards hosts the quiz in which contestants compete for the chance to win 10,000, with a single 'impossible' answer knocking them out for the day

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Jeremy Vine in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers' Bakeation
programme.desc: The duo's baking odyssey ends in northern Spain, where treats include local bread pan rustico, seafood empanadas and a spelt sausage roll packed with chorizo

programme.title: Home Is Where the Art Is
programme.desc: The three artists travel to a home in Birmingham, hoping to assist a buyer born on the weekend of the moon landings, who wants to mark her 50th birthday year with something out of this world

programme.title: Animals at Play
programme.desc: Part two of two. The secrets behind animals' group games, from dolphins that play catch to a hyena tug of war, revealing the benefits they gain from their playful behaviour. The programme examines how breaching the rules of a game can have fatal consequences - but how it also presents an opportunity for animals with a rigid hierarchy to break down social barriers

programme.title: Murder, Mystery and My Family: Case Closed?
programme.desc: Criminal barristers Jeremy Dein and Sasha Wass look back at their investigation of a rural case of murder and moonlighting in Ireland in 1894, when James Donovan was dragged from his bed and beaten to death by two men

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: At Ragley Hall, Warwickshire, antiques experts Christina Trevanion and Charlie Ross find a selection of antiques and collectibles to take to auction. Christina gets to grips with a weighty jardiniere, Charlie tests out a horse-measuring stick on its owner and presenter Paul Martin steps into the world of folk art

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Jessie Cave, Ayesha Hazarika, Simon Hickson and AJ Pritchard hope they have what it takes to win the final challenges, while Richard Osman asks the questions

programme.title: Great Coastal Railway Journeys
programme.desc: The final leg of this South Coast adventure begins in Fishbourne, the location of one of the most significant Roman sites in Britain. Heading into East Sussex, Michael Portillo visits Brighton, and for the final stop he celebrates the burgeoning winemaking industry of the South Downs

programme.title: Today at the Test
programme.desc: England v Australia. Action from day one of the First Test in the five-match Ashes series from Edgbaston, Birmingham, as England try to regain the Ashes for the first time since 2015. The last series between the two sides on these shores ended in a memorable 2-2 draw back in 2019

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The team are Birmingham-bound for the annual Gardeners' World Live event. Monty Don, Arit Anderson, Adam Frost, Sue Kent, Carol Klein, Joe Swift, Rachel de Thame and Frances Tophill focus on design inspiration in the show gardens and the latest plants and flowers in the floral marquee

programme.title: Hidden Treasures of the National Trust
programme.desc: Cameras focus on the teams at work at the 'big houses' of Northern Ireland. Highlights of the final episode include the battle to save unique dodo and dinosaur statues in a garden, the hidden story behind a portrait, and a Victorian garden seat's restoration to its former glory

programme.title: Mortimer & Whitehouse: Gone Fishing
programme.desc: Paul and Bob set off in a punt to fish for perch on a weir pool on the River Thames, leaving poor old terrier Ted forlorn on the river bank as he is not allowed on the boat with them. After a tiring morning, they decide to fish an altogether quieter spot and sit on the bankside discussing their guilty pleasures in music. They also chat to author and comic, Richard Herring, who discusses his recent battle with testicular cancer

programme.desc: The day's important national and international news stories with Victoria Derbyshire

programme.title: The French Connection (1971)
programme.desc: Two tough New York cops use unorthodox methods to try to break an international drug ring. When their information leads them to place a candy store under surveillance, they discover the owners are the American agents for a French kingpin planning to ship millions of dollars worth of heroin into the US. Oscar-winning fact-based thriller, starring Gene Hackman, Roy Scheider, Fernando Rey and Tony Lo Bianco

programme.title: Panorama

programme.title: Once Upon a Time in Northern Ireland
programme.desc: The devastating impact of the conflict is explored through the stories of three women, as IRA prisoners begin their hunger strike in protest against Margaret Thatcher's policies. Tit for tat killings, car bombs and assassinations became commonplace in Northern Ireland and fatigue from a population desperate for a respite from the cycle of violence creeps in

programme.title: Forensics: The Real CSI
programme.desc: A 12-year-old girl comes forward to say she has been groomed online and raped several times, so West Midlands Police quickly identify and arrest the suspect. However, as it is several weeks since the alleged attacks, there is limited physical evidence, so the officers have to rely on digital forensics, leaning heavily on two smartphones seized from the suspect

programme.title: Blue Peter
programme.desc: The team shows how to make an ingenious Father's Day card that doubles up as a paper aeroplane, while Joel finds out if he has what it takes to make it as a firefighter

programme.title: Pooch Perfect
programme.desc: Sheridan Smith and her canine co-host Stanley open the doors of the Pooch Parlour to the last of the 16 dog groomers. First they tackle a quartet of cute Pomeranians, having to achieve a perfect pom-pom ball shape using scissors only. Then four party pooches hit the Dogwalk as a family of poodles and a Yorkshire terrier strut their stuff, having been given a makeover by the contestants. Who will judges Verity Hardcastle and Colin Taylor choose to go through to the quarter-finals?

programme.title: Family Cooking Showdown
programme.desc: The families tackle a Catalan fish stew in a 'Taste It Now Make It' challenge. They are then given a whole salmon and tasked with creating a selection of dishes that will use as much of the fish as possible. The families are pushed to their limits as they vie to stay in the competition. Presented by Angellica Bell and Tommy Banks

programme.title: Food & Drink
programme.desc: Tom Kerridge is joined by Cyrus Todiwala (The Incredible Spice Men) to discuss the benefits of wholesome food, with the host challenging the award-winning Indian chef to come up with an alternative take on a curry to rival his own spice-crusted tuna salad. Comedienne Arabella Weir tries her hardest to fall in love with salad, and drinks expert Joe Wadsack picks a selection of healthy red wines

programme.title: Talking Pictures
programme.desc: Sylvia Syms narrates a history of Westerns, covering the golden age of the 1940s and '50s, the European influence of the Spaghetti Westerns, and the stars that keep the western alive and popular even today. Featuring interviews with Gary Cooper, James Stewart, Yul Brynner, Paul Newman, John Wayne and Clint Eastwood.

programme.title: The Magnificent Seven (1960)
programme.desc: Oppressed Mexican villagers cross the border into America looking to buy guns to defend their homes and crops from bandits. Instead they encounter an enigmatic loner who persuades them to hire a band of gunslingers to teach the villagers how to fight before the marauders return. Western, with Yul Brynner, Steve McQueen, Charles Bronson, Robert Vaughn, James Coburn and Eli Wallach

programme.title: Natural World
programme.desc: An insight into the endangered spectacled bears that live in reduced numbers in Peru, and about which little was known until recent years when zoologists were forced to reassess their preconception of them as gentle, vegetarian creatures. Narrated by Stephen Fry

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Paul Martin presents from Sandon Hall in Staffordshire, where antiques experts Christina Trevanion and Charles Hanson uncover a few gems including a silver ladle with a surprise in its bowl and a train set brought in by the son of William Moorcroft, the world-famous ceramicist. Plus, Paul finds out about the epic 18th-century voyage by the second Englishman to circumnavigate the globe

programme.title: Hidden Treasures of the National Trust
programme.desc: Cameras focus on the teams at work at the 'big houses' of Northern Ireland. Highlights of the final episode include the battle to save unique dodo and dinosaur statues in a garden, the hidden story behind a portrait, and a Victorian garden seat's restoration to its former glory

programme.title: Dad's Army
programme.desc: Sgt Wilson struggles to concentrate on his Home Guard duties when he has a personal problem to contend with. Classic comedy, starring John Le Mesurier and Arthur Lowe

programme.title: Trooping the Colour Highlights
programme.desc: The ceremony to mark the official birthday of King Charles, performed by British and Commonwealth army regiments, from Horse Guards Parade in London

programme.title: Today at the Test
programme.desc: England v Australia. Action from day two of the First Test in the five-match Ashes series from Edgbaston, Birmingham. The Aussies regained the famous urn in with a series victory on home soil in 2017-18 and have twice successfully defended it since, drawing 2-2 in England in 2019 and winning in Australia in 2021-22

programme.title: George Michael at the BBC
programme.desc: The much-missed singer-songwriter was one of Britain's best-loved and most acclaimed music stars, rising to superstardom in the 1980s phenomenon with Wham!, before his subsequent solo work took his career to a whole new level. This collection of appearances on the BBC by the singer-songwriter both solo and as part of Wham! includes performances of Club Tropicana, Freedom, Faith, Outside and Amazing

programme.title: Later... with Jools Holland
programme.desc: LA-based gospel-soul trio Gabriels perform songs from their second album, Angels & Queens: Part Two, and Malian musician Fatoumata Diawara demonstrates her blend of contemporary and traditional sounds, including a collaboration with Damon Albarn. Stereophonics frontman Kelly Jones returns with his new project Far from Saints, with the Wind and the Wave's Patty Lynn and Dwight Baker, Fontaines DC singer Grian Chatten makes his solo debut on the show, as does rising soul star Elmiene. Sharleen Spiteri joins Jools for a chat to discuss Texas's recently released greatest hits album and their forthcoming performance on the Pyramid Stage at Glastonbury

programme.title: George Michael: Live in London
programme.desc: Footage of the award-winning singer-songwriter's two shows at Earls Court in August 2008, which were part of his record-breaking 25 Live tour. The artist performs renditions of his most popular hits to a sell-out crowd, including I'm Your Man, Everything She Wants, Careless Whisper, Faith, Freedom! '90, Too Funky, A Different Corner, Amazing and Outside

programme.title: Glastonbury
programme.desc: A look back at last year's Glastonbury Festival, where the likes of Paul McCartney, Billie Eilish, Kendrick Lamar, Diana Ross, Sam Fender, Olivia Rodrigo, Years & Years, Little Simz and many more all took to the stage in what was a memorable return to Worthy Farm

programme.title: Africa Rising with Afua Hirsch
programme.desc: Writer and broadcaster Afua Hirsch explores how young creatives are reinventing culture across Africa. She begins in Morocco, where she meets renowned photographer Hassan Hajjaj, who is updating traditional Moroccan style, goes riding with Tbourida horse rider Amal Amhari and explores Amazigh rug weaving with artist Sarah Allaoui. Afua also meets the country's new superstar singer Rym Fikri

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: The Sky at Night
programme.desc: The team investigates the science and engineering helping the UK to blast into space. Chris Lintott visits a rocket company near Glasgow to find out how rockets are built

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's Made in Britain
programme.desc: Fred travels to the Lake District, which was once one of Britain's biggest sources of iron ore. He also takes a trip across a lake in a steamboat, examines how the rail industry made use of local metals, and finally enjoys a pint with former steelworkers in a local pub

programme.title: Meet Me in St Louis (1944)
programme.desc: A job offer tempts a banker to consider uprooting his close-knit family and moving to New York. However, his wife and children struggle with the prospect of leaving their friends behind, and are horrified when they realise they might miss out on the 1904 St Louis World's Fair. Meanwhile, teenage daughter Esther faces the abrupt termination of her romance with the boy next door. Musical, starring Judy Garland, Tom Drake and Margaret O'Brien

programme.title: Around the World in 80 Treasures Shorts
programme.desc: Dan Cruickshank tries to find the Ark of the Covenant, travelling across Ethiopia in search of the lost relic

programme.title: BBC Cardiff Singer of the World
programme.desc: Petroc Trelawny and Josie d'Arby present full coverage of the Song Prize Final. Five singers perform the intimate and demanding discipline of 'art song' or Lieder - and with just a solo singer and piano on stage there really is no place to hide. The judges are Welsh soprano Rosemary Joshua, Argentinian mezzo-soprano Bernarda Fink, accompanist Anna Tilbrook, award-winning composer Errollyn Wallen and chair of the jury John Gilhooly, director of London's Wigmore Hall. Petroc and Josie are joined by Irish soprano Ailish Tynan, who won this competition 20 years ago

programme.title: Johnny Kingdom: A Year on Exmoor
programme.desc: A quiet January for the amateur cameraman soon turns busy when wild boar become loose in the Devonshire countryside, bringing Britain's media to the area. Johnny also films spoonbills, finding a unique way to get close to the migrating birds

programme.title: Johnny Kingdom: A Year on Exmoor
programme.desc: Spring proves a busy time for the amateur cameraman, but his mind is elsewhere as his pet deer Bambi falls sick. Johnny rescued the three-legged animal 12 years ago, but her illness leaves him facing a difficult decision

programme.title: Arena
programme.desc: The story of the influential African musician Fela Kuti, who is remembered not only as the creator of the Afrobeat genre but also as an outspoken political revolutionary who criticised military regimes in his native Nigeria. A counter-cultural revolutionary, he fought injustice with his music and provoked society with his lifestyle, on one occasion marrying 27 wives in a single ceremony. When he died in 1997 from HIV, a disease that carried huge stigma in Africa, there was fear his legacy would die with him, but this film shows that the impact of his life and music is still felt today

programme.title: Andrew Davies: Rewriting the Classics
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the creative process of the screenwriter behind some of TV's most acclaimed adaptations of classic literature, from the 1995 version of Pride and Prejudice to the 2018 dramatisation of Victor Hugo's Les Miserables. He also discusses how to go about transforming sprawling, lengthy and detailed novels into primetime drama, turning one art form into another altogether different one. With contributions from authors Sarah Waters and Helen Fielding, actors Dominic West and Olivia Colman, and industry figures Jane Tranter and Sue Birtwhistle

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's Made in Britain
programme.desc: Fred travels to the Lake District, which was once one of Britain's biggest sources of iron ore. He also takes a trip across a lake in a steamboat, examines how the rail industry made use of local metals, and finally enjoys a pint with former steelworkers in a local pub

programme.title: Top of the Pops

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Neneh Cherry presents studio performances and videos from December 8, 1994, by Whigfield, PJ and Duncan, Mariah Carey, Boyzone, Gloria Estefan, EYC, Cliff Richard and Phil Everly, Jimmy Nail and East 17

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Peter Powell introduces musical performances by Linx, Phil Collins, Odyssey, Champaign, Siouxsie and the Banshees, the Specials, Imagination and Smokey Robinson. Plus, a dance sequence by Legs & Co. First shown in June 1981

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Mike Read presents an edition from June 14, 1979, featuring performances by Match, McFadden & Whitehead, Edwin Starr, Tubeway Army, Janet Key, Chas & Dave and Anita Ward. Plus, dance sequences by Legs & Co

programme.title: Nina Simone: Live at Montreux 1976
programme.desc: The singer-songwriter in concert at the Swiss jazz festival, featuring songs including Little Girl Blue, Backlash Blues, Stars and I Wish I Knew How It Would Feel to Be Free

programme.title: They All Came Out to Montreux
programme.desc: Documentary about the history of the Montreux Jazz Festival and its founder Claude Nobs. Featuring music by Aretha Franklin, Eddie Harris and Les McCann, Ella Fitzgerald, Nina Simone, Claude Nobs and Champion Jack Dupree, Ten Years After, Led Zeppelin, Santana, Roberta Flack and Deep Purple

programme.title: They All Came Out to Montreux
programme.desc: The music documentary continues, with archive performances by Carole King, Muddy Waters, Monty Alexander, Etta James, Gilberto Gil, King Sunny, David Bowie and Freddie Mercury, Talking Heads, Van Morrison and James Brown

programme.title: They All Came Out to Montreux
programme.desc: The conclusion of the documentary about the Montreux Jazz Festival and its founder Claude Nobs. Featuring archive performances by Marvin Gaye, George Clinton, Buddy Guy, Herbie Hancock, Ray Charles, Miles Davis, Sting, the Roots, ZZ Top, David Bowie, Alica Keys, Prince and Wyclef Jean

programme.title: Secret Knowledge
programme.desc: Soul singer Laura Mvula travels to New York City to explore the songs made famous by Nina Simone that mean the most to her, and trace the singer's musical roots with the help of those who knew the 'High Priestess of Soul'. Laura reveals the influence of Nina's classical training, meets Simone's long-time guitarist Al Shackman and performs with a Harlem gospel choir as she pays tribute to the genius of her musical heroine

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Lily Savage presents music by Sophie B Hawkins, Roxette, the Stone Roses, Erasure, Celine Dion, Mariah Carey, Mighty Morph'n Power Rangers, East 17 and Baby D from December 1, 1994

programme.title: Top of the Pops

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Peter Powell introduces musical performances by Linx, Phil Collins, Odyssey, Champaign, Siouxsie and the Banshees, the Specials, Imagination and Smokey Robinson. Plus, a dance sequence by Legs & Co. First shown in June 1981

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Mike Read presents an edition from June 14, 1979, featuring performances by Match, McFadden & Whitehead, Edwin Starr, Tubeway Army, Janet Key, Chas & Dave and Anita Ward. Plus, dance sequences by Legs & Co

programme.title: Caribbean with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: The adventurer travels around the islands and mainland coast of the Caribbean Sea, beginning on Hispaniola. He joins the Dominican Republic police's anti-narcotics division, before crossing the border to Haiti to see the notorious tented slums of Cite Soleil, while also discovering a vibrant, colourful and thriving side to the country. He ends this leg of his journey in Puerto Rico, an archipelago that is a territory of the United States, and examines the legacy of bombing and weapons testing on the island of Vieques

programme.title: Voyages of Discovery
programme.desc: Paul Rose investigates Norwegian explorer Fridtjof Nansen's expedition to reach the North Pole in 1893. Despite his failure to persuade any scientists to join him, Nansen became a pioneer of polar exploration techniques when he allowed his ship to become stuck in pack ice, hoping it would drift toward his destination

programme.title: Kursk: The Last Mission (2018)
programme.desc: Explosions aboard a Russian submarine cause it to sink during a naval exercise in the Barents Sea, leaving 23 survivors trapped on the ocean floor. For the next seven days, members of a rescue team frantically work to reach the men before their dwindling oxygen supply runs out. Fact-based drama, starring Matthias Schoenaerts, La Seydoux and Colin Firth

programme.title: Aliens: The Big Thinkers
programme.desc: The search for extraterrestrials is no longer sci-fi - it is a question engaging some of the greatest minds in science. This documentary gets inside the minds of scientists exploring the possibilities of what could be out there, including Professor Martin Rees, the Astronomer Royal, who thinks the common idea of organic aliens is all wrong

programme.title: Horizon
programme.desc: The scientists scouring the universe for signs of extraterrestrial life, including the film researchers at the Green Bank Telescope searching for radio signals from 'Tabby's Star', a star so mysterious some scientists believe it might be surrounded by a Dyson Sphere - a vast energy collector built by advanced aliens. The film also features the 2006 discovery by husband and wife team Duncan Lorimer and Maura McLaughlin of an enigmatic signal from space, known as a fast radio burst, and its subsequent explanations

programme.title: Hancock's Half Hour
programme.desc: Hancock decides to donate blood but is aghast to find out how much he has to give. When he discovers he has a rare blood type, he wants to find out where it will end up

programme.title: Whatever Happened to the Likely Lads?
programme.desc: Bob and Terry seek sanctuary from the news so they can watch TV highlights of an England v Bulgaria football match without knowing the result, but they are pursued by the relentless Flint, who has bet them they cannot escape the final score. James Bolam and Rodney Bewes star, with Brian Glover and Donald Gee

programme.desc: Lee Burkhill and Chris Hull head to Nottingham, where they meet retired couple Jennifer and Alfred. Having had building work done on their downsized home, their garden has been left looking like a builder's yard with rubble, large concrete pads and a gigantic, ugly shed. Jennifer would love a garden to relax and read in the sun and Alfred would like a dedicated spot for his barbecue, where he can prepare meals with his grandchildren. Both love the modern, clean lines Mediterranean look and would to incorporate some olive trees. Lee and Chris set out to meet their wishes with a healthy 6,500 budget at their disposal

Family joker Mark can't resist soaking his dad, but an angry Mark Sr gets his revenge. As the sun sets, an emotional Mark opens up to his comnpanions, admitting an obsession with work isolated him from his family, changed him as a person and almost pushed him to the edge

Also hoping that the numbers fall their way are Kelvin and his fiance Linda. This couple have been engaged for five years, but if Kelvin strikes it lucky, might Linda be finally persuaded to set a date? Across the hall and dabbing for gold are '70-something' Jeff and Dave. Both widowers, their blossoming bromance has eased their grief

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc: Adventurer Bear Grylls traces his ancestry, starting by exploring his paternal army-serving grandfather Ted Grylls' old trunk, intriguingly full of documents marked 'Top Secret'. Next, Bear wants finds out more about the life of his beloved grandad Neville. His father - Bear's great grandfather - is revealed to be a loving family man and progressive headmaster who modernised Harrow School. Bear eventually traces the family line back several centuries revealing, to his delight, Scottish ancestry. A trip to north of the border uncovers the story of Bear's 10-X great grandfather, the Duke of Argyll

She has 3,500 to spare, hoping Charlie and Chris can make her dreams come true.

programme.title: Wynne's Welsh 70s
programme.desc: Alongside his dog Ginny, the celebrated tenor and broadcaster mines BBC Wales's archives of 1976 to present some of that year's TV gold. Featuring memories of one of the hottest summers on record, and clips of a woman called Gert revealing her secrets to a good chimney sweep and Wales winning the Triple Crown. Wynne also shares film of his holidays with his grandma at Pendine sands

programme.title: Question of Sport
programme.desc: With former rugby union star James Haskell, ex-England bowler Ryan Sidebottom, 4x100m relay world champion Nethaneel Mitchell-Blake and European weightlifting gold medallist Emily Campbell join team captains Ugo Monye and Sam Quek and host Paddy McGuinness on the quiz

programme.title: Our Lives
programme.desc: The story of keen sailor Natasha Lambert, who has cerebral palsy. Natasha cannot use her arms or legs, so her father invented a system that would enable her to control a boat by breathing in and out of a straw. First, she sailed the Solent and then traversed the English Channel. Each time her challenges got bigger and bigger. Now, Natasha wants to control a 46-ft yacht across the Atlantic. This documentary charts a family determined to enable Natasha to fulfil her dream, illustrating how her ambition has inspired all of them

programme.title: Have I Got News for You

programme.title: Queen of Oz
programme.desc: Comedy about the black sheep of a fictional British royal family, Princess Georgiana. On the back of her latest scandal her father, the King, makes the unprecedented move of abdicating his Australian throne in favour of her, hoping that sending her 10,000 miles away from London will give Georgiana some real responsibility and finally be the making of her. A welcome reception is Georgie's first public appearance Down Under, where an offensive faux pas from the jet-lagged new Queen makes the night go from bad to worse. Comedy, starring Catherine Tate

programme.desc: The hosts are joined by comedian Katherine Ryan and her husband Bobby Kootstra, who discuss rekindling their relationship after spending decades apart. Features include Please Keep Me Anonymous, where a well-known face reads out some terrifying audience confessions and It Goes or I Go, where audience members compete to rid themselves of something their loved one refuses to remove from the house

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Comedians Jo Brand and Joe Wilkinson, weather presenter Lucy Martin and journalist Amol Rajan join host Rob Brydon and regular captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the offbeat panel show. As usual, the participants set out to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible fibs about themselves in a bid to secure a team victory, through rounds such as Home Truths and Quick-fire Lies

programme.title: David Brent: Life on the Road (2016)
programme.desc: More than a decade on from his appearance in documentary series The Office, a film crew is once again following the life of David Brent. He is now working as a rep for a cleaning-goods distributor, but harbours dreams of making it big in the music business. Acting on this, he takes three weeks off work and tours with a new-look version of Foregone Conclusion, the band he fronted in the 1990s. Comedy, directed by and starring Ricky Gervais

programme.title: Trooping the Colour: The King's Birthday Parade
programme.desc: Huw Edwards introduces live coverage of King Charles III's first official birthday parade. From the heart of London, the Welsh Guards troop their colour on Horse Guards Parade in a world-renowned spectacle full of music, majesty and military precision. The morning's events culminate with the annual RAF fly-past and the royal family's iconic balcony appearance. JJ Chalmers speaks live to those associated with this remarkable day

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Eric Knowles is at the helm with experts Danny Sebastian and Caroline Hawley, as two teams scour the antiques centre in the hope that they can make the greater profit at auction. There are plenty of highs and lows in the saleroom, while Eric also gets the chance to meet an unlikely war hero

programme.title: Live Challenge Cup Rugby League
programme.desc: Hull FC v St Helens (Kick-off 2.30pm). All the action from the quarter-final at MKM Stadium. Hull have struggled for consistency in the Super League this season, but claimed a convincing 32-8 victory away to Castleford Tigers in the previous round. The Saints won 26-6 at Championship side Halifax Panthers last time out and have also been below their best at times so far this term

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Charlie and the Rich brother's face one of their hardest ever garden rescues to date in Stowmarket, turning a concrete space into a family friendly back garden

programme.title: The Hit List
programme.desc: Marvin and Rochelle Humes present a celebrity edition of the music-based quiz show. Food critic Jay Rayner and baker John Whaite, Steps stars Faye Tozer and Ian 'H' Watkins, and comedians Jayde Adams and Babatunde Alsh must name as many hit songs and artists as possible, with a 10,000 jackpot for their chosen charity up for grabs

programme.title: Michael McIntyre's The Wheel
programme.desc: The comedian hosts the Saturday-night gameshow, in which contestants take on a colossal spinning wheel and answer questions in the hope of securing a cash prize. Tonight's expert celebrity advice comes from Chris Moyles on breakfast radio, Clare Balding on Wimbledon, Josh Widdicombe on Neighbours, Yung Filly on YouTube, Frankie Bridge on girl groups, Owain Wyn Evans on weather and Rustie Lee on food

programme.title: Pointless Celebrities
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman present a star-studded version of the general knowledge quiz. Stephen Bailey, Janine Harouni, Tony Way, Ethan Lawrence, Priya Davdra, Kimberly Hart-Simpson, Nabil Abdul Rashid and Felicity Ward try to come up with the least likely correct answers to a series of questions posed to members of the public

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Jan's actions have a disastrous impact on her personal life as she and Iain deal with a road accident involving a vehicle transporting a heart for an urgent transplant. Jodie takes Max's advice following a hard day, possibly against her better judgement, and Jacob becomes insecure when Sah comments on his age

programme.title: Annika
programme.desc: The DI and her team are tasked with solving the murder of a man who was thrown in the river from a party boat - an investigation made all the more difficult by the fact that everyone supposedly loved the victim

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Annika
programme.desc: A young woman murdered on the Glasgow docks hits the officers hard when Michael's brother is named as the next of kin. As the team investigates, Michael is taken off the case

programme.title: The Deer Hunter (1978)
programme.desc: The lives of three American steelworkers and their families are torn apart in the wake of the Vietnam War. After enduring horrific treatment in a prison camp during the conflict, the three friends return to their homes but struggle to readjust to normal life. Oscar-winning drama, starring Robert De Niro, Christopher Walken, Meryl Streep, John Savage and John Cazale in his last film role

programme.title: Breakfast
