programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: Claimed and Shamed
programme.desc: A DJ's injury claim hits the deck when online posts show he'd been spinning a tall tale, while a driver who demanded a cash payout after a collision is caught out by her own texts. Plus, investigators uncover the hidden link between a group of strangers claiming thousands of pounds after a car crash

programme.title: Dirty Rotten Scammers
programme.desc: Care worker Peter lost out on 3,000 when scammers convinced him they were from his bank's fraud team. Jim Browning is the scourge of the scammers working with the police to get them arrested. Presented by Michelle and Mavis Ackerley

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Richard Madley and Kate Bliss help two teams look for items at the International Antiques Fair of Wales in Builth Wells, Powys. Charlie Ross visits the National Fencing Musuem

programme.title: Scottish First Minister's Questions
programme.desc: Kirsten Campbell introduces coverage of questions to First Minister Humza Yousaf in the Scottish Parliament

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Scarlett has her first driving lesson, Jimmi tries to convince Emma to return to being a forensic medical examiner with the police, while Suni helps a dancing couple get back on their feet

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Jacqui Joseph finds a drop-leaf table, a pair of legless dining chairs and a collection of unwanted curtains at High Wycombe recycling centre for her and the team to upcycle

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin helps a retired couple who want to reconnect with their Scottish roots in Ayrshire. They have a budget of 500,000 and a view over water is a priority. Away from the search, Jonnie also learns about an ancient technique to create salt using sea water and an impressive tower of blackthorn branches

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Lee Burkhill and Chris Hull head to Nottingham, where they meet retired couple Jennifer and Alfred. Having had building work done on their downsized home, their garden has been left looking like a builder's yard with rubble, large concrete pads and a gigantic, ugly shed. Jennifer would love a garden to relax and read in the sun and Alfred would like a dedicated spot for his barbecue, where he can prepare meals with his grandchildren. Both love the modern, clean lines Mediterranean look and would to incorporate some olive trees. Lee and Chris set out to meet their wishes with a healthy 6,500 budget at their disposal

programme.title: Clean It, Fix It
programme.desc: The team arrives in Kent to help solve a family-of-four's housing woes. They have just 24 hours and a limited budget to fix an unfinished kitchen extension with bare plaster work. The kitchen is addressed as part of a bid to redesign the utility space to make their dream home a reality.

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Stephen Mangan joins Alexander Armstrong to co-host the quiz, in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the most obscure answers

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: River City
programme.desc: Scarlett's resolve is tested when Andrew makes an admission, but will she stand by her man? Meanwhile, Rebecca is forced to be honest with Angus when he makes an awkward assumption, and Suzie faces a crisis of confidence on the day of her amateur theatre dress rehearsal

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Vinny gives Suki an ultimatum and Stacey worries about Lily when Amy tells her about the older man who bought her trainers. Tensions are high at Elaine's girly pamper day and Rocky tries to help Kathy get the guests she wants at her wedding

programme.title: A Wright Family Holiday
programme.desc: Mark Wright, his brother Josh and father Mark Sr head to Skegness, Lincolnshire. After enjoying the resort's pier and funfair, the trio hit the beach. Over a meal of fish and chips, they reminisce about the family holidays of Josh and Mark's childhood. Next, the trio take to the water on jet skis. Family joker Mark can't resist soaking his dad, but an angry Mark Sr gets his revenge. As the sun sets, an emotional Mark opens up to his comnpanions, admitting an obsession with work isolated him from his family, changed him as a person and almost pushed him to the edge

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Charlie Dimmock and Lee Burkhill head to Chorlton, Greater Manchester, where they come up with designs for a garden that will remind owners Louise and Steve of their wedding in New Orleans. The couple's garden already has some mature plants that the designers are keen to incorporate to full effect, plus they already have an attractive pond that they'd like the duo to expand without disturbing its current inhabitants. Charlie and Lee try to bring the US to the north-west on a budget of 4,000

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc: Adventurer Bear Grylls traces his ancestry, starting by exploring his paternal army-serving grandfather Ted Grylls' old trunk, intriguingly full of documents marked 'Top Secret'. Next, Bear wants finds out more about the life of his beloved grandad Neville. His father - Bear's great grandfather - is revealed to be a loving family man and progressive headmaster who modernised Harrow School. Bear eventually traces the family line back several centuries revealing, to his delight, Scottish ancestry. A trip to north of the border uncovers the story of Bear's 10-X great grandfather, the Duke of Argyll

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the topical debate from Deeside, Wales, inviting a panel of politicians and other guests to answer questions from an invited audience on subjects that have made the headlines over the past week

programme.title: Newscast
programme.desc: Light-hearted discussion of the week's political events

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: Claimed and Shamed
programme.desc: Naga Munchetty revisits more shocking stories from the archive, including the American ex-wife - the beneficiary of a life insurance policy - who sought deadly revenge after a bitter divorce. Plus, the conman who blatantly fabricated his bogus damage claim by crashing his own car in broad daylight

programme.title: Dirty Rotten Scammers
programme.desc: Tip and advice are offered to a man who is worried his elderly father may be susceptible to scammers. Presented by Michelle and Mavis Ackerley

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: In Dewsbury, West Yorkshire, a midwife and her builder husband buy a house which hasn't been lived in for a decade. However, they have big plans to create their forever home for them and their four children. Plus, two houses in Worksop, Nottinghamshire, and Wakefield, West Yorkshire are bought at auction by developers who plan to rent them out. Presenters including Martin Roberts, Dion Dublin and Martel Maxwell follow the fortunes of new new owners as they bring their plans to fruition

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Christina Trevanion presides as two teams shop for antiques in Nottinghamshire, with experts Raj Bisram and Roo Irvine offering the contenders sage advice. Christina also meets a world record-holding collector of tea towels

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The clerical sleuth must delve into the past and open up old wounds when a child killer is found murdered. Crime drama, with a guest appearance by John Thomson

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Jay Blades is at Walsall Recycling Centre in search of two items headed for the skip that he can rework and repurpose to reveal their true potential. Bristol-based upholsterer Leigh-Anne Treadwell attempts to give a set of mid-century chairs a style overhaul. For his own project, Jay has two tables to transform

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Sonali Shah helps a soon-to-be retired vicar and her husband on their search for a new home in the countryside of Gloucestershire. She also visits Adam Henson of Countryfile fame at his farm dedicated to the conservation of some of the rarest livestock breeds in the world

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: In Telford, Shropshire, Charlie Dimmock and Chris Hull set out to design a cat friendly 'enchanted' garden. Lesley would love an enchanted space suitable for her beloved cat Gizmo to share with her, and importantly, her very own outdoor gin bar to relax with her friends. She has 3,500 to spare, hoping Charlie and Chris can make her dreams come true.

programme.title: Clean It, Fix It
programme.desc: The team is in Bedford to help a family-of-six bursting at the seams. They have just 24 hours and a limited budget to turn a dining room into a much-needed bedroom. The helpers also create an area for the family to eat, transforming an old utility space into a breakfast bar

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong hosts the quiz in which contestants try to record the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Lauren Laverne reveals the correct answers and comments on the players' scores

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Roman Kemp round off the working week with a mixture of celebrity chat and stories of interest

programme.title: Our Lives
programme.desc: The story of keen sailor Natasha Lambert, who has cerebral palsy. Natasha cannot use her arms or legs, so her father invented a system that would enable her to control a boat by breathing in and out of a straw. First, she sailed the Solent and then traversed the English Channel. Each time her challenges got bigger and bigger. Now, Natasha wants to control a 46-ft yacht across the Atlantic. This documentary charts a family determined to enable Natasha to fulfil her dream, illustrating how her ambition has inspired all of them

programme.title: Landward
programme.desc: Dougie Vipond cycles along a trail in Glentress Forest in the Borders that is being used in the UCI Cycling World Championships this summer, finding out how the wild habitat is being protected. Arlene Stuart visits an estate in the Angus glens that is working to increase the number of barn owls, seeing some of this year's chicks up close as they're checked and tagged as part of a conservation project

programme.title: Question of Sport
programme.desc: With former rugby union star James Haskell, ex-England bowler Ryan Sidebottom, 4x100m relay world champion Nethaneel Mitchell-Blake and European weightlifting gold medallist Emily Campbell join team captains Ugo Monye and Sam Quek and host Paddy McGuinness on the quiz

programme.title: Have I Got News for You
programme.desc: BBC News reporter Clive Myrie guest hosts, with actor Munya Chawawa and journalist Helen Lewis joining team captains Paul Merton and Ian Hislop to delve into the comedic side of recent headline stories

programme.title: Queen of Oz
programme.desc: Comedy about the black sheep of a fictional British royal family, Princess Georgiana. On the back of her latest scandal her father, the King, makes the unprecedented move of abdicating his Australian throne in favour of her, hoping that sending her 10,000 miles away from London will give Georgiana some real responsibility and finally be the making of her. A welcome reception is Georgie's first public appearance Down Under, where an offensive faux pas from the jet-lagged new Queen makes the night go from bad to worse. Comedy, starring Catherine Tate

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: The Chris & Rosie Ramsey Show
programme.desc: The hosts are joined by comedian Katherine Ryan and her husband Bobby Kootstra, who discuss rekindling their relationship after spending decades apart. Features include Please Keep Me Anonymous, where a well-known face reads out some terrifying audience confessions and It Goes or I Go, where audience members compete to rid themselves of something their loved one refuses to remove from the house

programme.title: Bump
programme.desc: Bowie is babysitting and Vince is in crisis, but Reema is there to help him through it. Keeks is keen to take the next step with Santi, and Oly is thinking about her future with Michael. Bowie, looking for love in all the wrong places, joins Dom on his first mandate with Tim at a microbrewery, where he spills the beans on the inspiration behind his dad's friend-finding app. Later, an awkward run-in with Angie and Edith results in the talk Dom and Angie had been putting off. Santi and Oly join Skye and Madison and Karl and Austin at the school parents' 1980s trivia night fundraiser, where they get a solid lesson in how not to grow up. Bowie gets unexpectedly lucky at last, but things go very wrong for him. Australian drama, starring Nathalie Morris

programme.title: Bump
programme.desc: Oly makes an important declaration, but she's blindsided with an outcome she wasn't hoping for. Santi and Oly face an emotional reckoning when a frightening crisis forces them to confront what really matters. Vince and Reema's relationship finally crosses a threshold, as Ariel's birth preparations push them together. Zac brings Talia back to the fold, and things get real for Ariel, Talia and Vince as Ariel goes into labour - life will never be the same again. The birth of their baby pushes some long hidden truths into the open. Hector's bonding with Gabe looks like good news for Rosa, until Gabe takes things too far. A loved-up Bowie has a chilling omen for Angie and Edith. Australian drama, starring Nathalie Morris

programme.title: David Brent: Life on the Road (2016)
programme.desc: More than a decade on from his appearance in documentary series The Office, a film crew is once again following the life of David Brent. He is now working as a rep for a cleaning-goods distributor, but harbours dreams of making it big in the music business. Acting on this, he takes three weeks off work and tours with a new-look version of Foregone Conclusion, the band he fronted in the 1990s. Comedy, directed by and starring Ricky Gervais

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The clerical sleuth must delve into the past and open up old wounds when a child killer is found murdered. Crime drama, with a guest appearance by John Thomson

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Jay Blades is at Walsall Recycling Centre in search of two items headed for the skip that he can rework and repurpose to reveal their true potential. Bristol-based upholsterer Leigh-Anne Treadwell attempts to give a set of mid-century chairs a style overhaul. For his own project, Jay has two tables to transform

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Sonali Shah helps a soon-to-be retired vicar and her husband on their search for a new home in the countryside of Gloucestershire. She also visits Adam Henson of Countryfile fame at his farm dedicated to the conservation of some of the rarest livestock breeds in the world

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: In Telford, Shropshire, Charlie Dimmock and Chris Hull set out to design a cat friendly 'enchanted' garden. Lesley would love an enchanted space suitable for her beloved cat Gizmo to share with her, and importantly, her very own outdoor gin bar to relax with her friends. She has 3,500 to spare, hoping Charlie and Chris can make her dreams come true.

programme.title: Clean It, Fix It
programme.desc: The team is in Bedford to help a family-of-six bursting at the seams. They have just 24 hours and a limited budget to turn a dining room into a much-needed bedroom. The helpers also create an area for the family to eat, transforming an old utility space into a breakfast bar

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong hosts the quiz in which contestants try to record the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Lauren Laverne reveals the correct answers and comments on the players' scores

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Roman Kemp round off the working week with a mixture of celebrity chat and stories of interest

programme.title: Feed Yourself Fitter with Stephen Nolan
programme.desc: At 23 stone the lockdown wreaked havoc on Tait's diet. Commuting long hours to and from work and eating fast food takeaways en route means he can no longer run after or play with his young son Theo. Girlfriend Abbie is worried that his weight has ballooned so much in the past three years that he will not be around long enough to see Theo grow up. Chef Suzie Lee sets out to make Tait's much-loved but fattening takeaways a thing of the past by showing him how to cook fresh, delicious alternative meals at home

programme.title: Restoration Rescue
programme.desc: Patrick Bradley meets a couple planning to restore a fisherman's cottage in Lough Neagh, after the death of their friend who had lived there all her life . Their sentimental attachment means they want to keep as much of the character as possible but since the fabric of the cottage has seen better days this proves to be a challenge. Patrick takes the couple to the Ulster Folk Museum to learn what life would have been like for the fishermen who once lived in the cottage and they determine when it was originally built

programme.title: Our Lives
programme.desc: The story of keen sailor Natasha Lambert, who has cerebral palsy. Natasha cannot use her arms or legs, so her father invented a system that would enable her to control a boat by breathing in and out of a straw. First, she sailed the Solent and then traversed the English Channel. Each time her challenges got bigger and bigger. Now, Natasha wants to control a 46-ft yacht across the Atlantic. This documentary charts a family determined to enable Natasha to fulfil her dream, illustrating how her ambition has inspired all of them

programme.title: Have I Got News for You
programme.desc: BBC News reporter Clive Myrie guest hosts, with actor Munya Chawawa and journalist Helen Lewis joining team captains Paul Merton and Ian Hislop to delve into the comedic side of recent headline stories

programme.title: Queen of Oz
programme.desc: Comedy about the black sheep of a fictional British royal family, Princess Georgiana. On the back of her latest scandal her father, the King, makes the unprecedented move of abdicating his Australian throne in favour of her, hoping that sending her 10,000 miles away from London will give Georgiana some real responsibility and finally be the making of her. A welcome reception is Georgie's first public appearance Down Under, where an offensive faux pas from the jet-lagged new Queen makes the night go from bad to worse. Comedy, starring Catherine Tate

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Match of the Day from Northern Ireland
programme.desc: Denmark v Northern Ireland. Stephen Watson presents action from the UEFA Euro 2024 Group H qualifier at Parken Stadium in Copenhagen. With commentary by Joel Taggart

programme.title: The Chris & Rosie Ramsey Show
programme.desc: The hosts are joined by comedian Katherine Ryan and her husband Bobby Kootstra, who discuss rekindling their relationship after spending decades apart. Features include Please Keep Me Anonymous, where a well-known face reads out some terrifying audience confessions and It Goes or I Go, where audience members compete to rid themselves of something their loved one refuses to remove from the house

programme.title: Question of Sport
programme.desc: With former rugby union star James Haskell, ex-England bowler Ryan Sidebottom, 4x100m relay world champion Nethaneel Mitchell-Blake and European weightlifting gold medallist Emily Campbell join team captains Ugo Monye and Sam Quek and host Paddy McGuinness on the quiz

programme.title: Bump
programme.desc: Bowie is babysitting and Vince is in crisis, but Reema is there to help him through it. Keeks is keen to take the next step with Santi, and Oly is thinking about her future with Michael. Bowie, looking for love in all the wrong places, joins Dom on his first mandate with Tim at a microbrewery, where he spills the beans on the inspiration behind his dad's friend-finding app. Later, an awkward run-in with Angie and Edith results in the talk Dom and Angie had been putting off. Santi and Oly join Skye and Madison and Karl and Austin at the school parents' 1980s trivia night fundraiser, where they get a solid lesson in how not to grow up. Bowie gets unexpectedly lucky at last, but things go very wrong for him. Australian drama, starring Nathalie Morris

programme.title: Bump
programme.desc: Oly makes an important declaration, but she's blindsided with an outcome she wasn't hoping for. Santi and Oly face an emotional reckoning when a frightening crisis forces them to confront what really matters. Vince and Reema's relationship finally crosses a threshold, as Ariel's birth preparations push them together. Zac brings Talia back to the fold, and things get real for Ariel, Talia and Vince as Ariel goes into labour - life will never be the same again. The birth of their baby pushes some long hidden truths into the open. Hector's bonding with Gabe looks like good news for Rosa, until Gabe takes things too far. A loved-up Bowie has a chilling omen for Angie and Edith. Australian drama, starring Nathalie Morris

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Live
programme.desc: Anna Haugh is joined by chefs Chantelle Nicholson and Theo Randall, plus special guest Stacey Dooley. Olly Smith picks the wines to go with the studio dishes

programme.title: Trooping the Colour: The King's Birthday Parade
programme.desc: Huw Edwards introduces live coverage of King Charles III's first official birthday parade. From the heart of London, the Welsh Guards troop their colour on Horse Guards Parade in a world-renowned spectacle full of music, majesty and military precision. The morning's events culminate with the annual RAF fly-past and the royal family's iconic balcony appearance. JJ Chalmers speaks live to those associated with this remarkable day

programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Eric Knowles is at the helm with experts Danny Sebastian and Caroline Hawley, as two teams scour the antiques centre in the hope that they can make the greater profit at auction. programme.title: Live Challenge Cup Rugby League
programme.desc: Hull FC v St Helens (Kick-off 2.30pm). All the action from the quarter-final at MKM Stadium. Hull have struggled for consistency in the Super League this season, but claimed a convincing 32-8 victory away to Castleford Tigers in the previous round. The Saints won 26-6 at Championship side Halifax Panthers last time out and have also been below their best at times so far this term

programme.desc: The DI and her team are tasked with solving the murder of a man who was thrown in the river from a party boat - an investigation made all the more difficult by the fact that everyone supposedly loved the victim

Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as contestants Pete, Andrew, Janty and Kerri pit their wits against quiz genius the Chaser. Answering general knowledge questions, they each add as much money as they dare to the jackpot - but if anyone is caught they're out for good, leaving fewer players for the final chase

programme.desc: A prodigal son returns to claim his inheritance, setting off alarm bells for Ventress, whose instinct is confirmed when a series of accidents at the carpet factory signals the management's scant regard for life and limb. Meanwhile, Vernon Scripps spies an opportunity to make merry as well as money by organising a beauty pageant, but reckons without the determined opposition of disapproving Joyce Jowett, who will stop at nothing to halt the event

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Eric sets out to look for Gloria in London. Jack reports his Land Rover stolen, leaving Andy to explain that Daz has been up to his old tricks. Frances announces she's moving to Hull

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Elaine sees through Robert, while Marlon's nerve begins to fail as Charity's continued presence takes its toll, and Daz lands himself in hot water again after stealing Rodney's car

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Fiz finally cracks and tells Toyah about her precious boyfriend's sordid secret. Fred tries to convince Ashley not to go through with the paternity test and as Sarah's 16th birthday arrives, she and Todd excitedly plan a little time to themselves

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: Millionaire Gordon Cloade's wife is widowed for the second time at the tender age of 23, arousing the suspicions of his impoverished relatives. Fanning the flames of envy and hatred, psychic aunt Kathy Cloade reveals the grieving widow's first husband is in fact still alive, and a second death prompts Poirot to delve deeper into the family's dark secrets. David Suchet stars, with Jenny Agutter, Tim Piggot-Smith and Celia Imrie

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Hippies colonise Lawson's holiday cottages, causing much local dissent and tut-tutting. The only people who don't object to their presence are an undercover journalist in search of a scoop, and Vernon, who is not slow to spot a way of capitalising on the situation. Starring Geoffrey Hughes and Malcolm Tierney

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Christmas is just around the corner, but the last thing Aidensfield's residents feel like doing is over-indulging as a salmonella epidemic grips the village and Dr Summerbee struggles to maintain her goodwill. Meanwhile, Vernon decides the time is right to expand Bernie's funeral empire

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: Louisa wants Martin to engage more with James, so she arranges for him to take their baby to playgroup, where he has to pair up with a mother and daughter and sing songs. Meanwhile, Al signs up to a dating website, Bert is suspicious when he catches Jennifer in the bathroom with a needle, and Ruth moves into a cottage in the village, but soon has trouble with a grumpy new neighbour (Ronald Pickup)

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: Obsessive-compulsive Mrs Tishell returns to the village, but her affection for Martin quickly disappears when he refuses to pass her fit for work. As if he didn't have enough on his plate, the grumpy doctor must also face his fear of blood when tests show that Lorna has a high level of ferritin, which is placing a strain on her heart and liver. Meanwhile, PC Penhale hopes to be selected for an elite police squad by taking part in a survival training course - but ends up shooting himself in the foot

programme.title: Scott & Bailey
programme.desc: The duo continue to investigate one of the biggest and darkest cases they have ever faced. In the second edition, Rachel's safety is thrown into question when the killers change the rules of their sick game. Meanwhile, as a police officer, Janet is rendered powerless to protect her daughter, but she knows she must try to find a way to stop the madness. The crime drama returns for a fifth series, this time featuring a single crime throughout three parts. Starring Lesley Sharp and Suranne Jones

programme.title: Scott & Bailey
programme.desc: Rachel is criticised for a lack of progress with the investigation and she knows she must find both a murder weapon and the encryption code used to access the website. However, as the team makes a significant breakthrough in the case, DSI Julie Dodson makes a discovery which jeopardises Rachel's position as acting DI. Meanwhile, when Janet's attempt to help Taisie results in a complaint, her faith in justice is tested, and both Scott and Bailey have life-changing decisions to make about their futures. Crime drama, starring Lesley Sharp and Suranne Jones

programme.title: The Darling Buds of May
programme.desc: The season of goodwill descends on the Larkin household, and the family celebrates the 'perfick' Christmas. Drama, based on the characters created by HE Bates, starring David Jason, Pam Ferris and Catherine Zeta-Jones

programme.title: The Darling Buds of May
programme.desc: Ma Larkin wins a holiday weekend in Paris and Pop decides to make the trip special by treating it as a second honeymoon. Heart-warming drama, starring David Jason and Pam Ferris

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Shopping from home.

programme.title: On the Buses
programme.desc: The inspector bans all the garage staff from smoking on duty - with dangerous consequences. Starring Reg Varney, Doris Hare, Anna Karen and Michael Robbins

programme.title: Inspector Morse
programme.desc: Ghosts from the past return to haunt Morse as he investigates the apparent suicide of a terminally ill Oxford don whose widow turns out to be the woman the detective was set to marry in his youth. As the case develops, Lewis worries his partner's professionalism is being undermined. Starring John Thaw and Kevin Whately, with Joanna David, Samantha Bond, David Haig, Adrian Dunbar and James Grout

programme.title: Carry On Up the Khyber (1968)
programme.desc: British forces in colonial India find themselves in deep trouble when a manic local ruler discovers the soldiers' fearsome reputation is thoroughly undeserved - prompting open rebellion. Comedy, starring Sid James, Kenneth Williams, Charles Hawtrey, Roy Castle, Joan Sims, Bernard Bresslaw and Terry Scott

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The sleuth finds himself in interesting company as English socialites and American millionaires rub shoulders on board a train bound for the French Riviera. Passengers include oil magnate Rufus Van Aldin (Elliott Gould) and his daughter Ruth (Jaime Murray) - to whom he has given a magnificent ruby known as the Heart of Fire. With members of the aristocracy crammed into a confined space with their husbands, lovers and a renowned gemstone, murder cannot be far away. With Lindsay Duncan, Roger Lloyd Pack and James D'Arcy

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: Richard Abernethie is found dead shortly after disinheriting his sole heir and specifying that his legacy is to be divided equally among the remaining family members. Poirot is called in by his solicitor friend Gilbert Entwhistle, to ascertain whether the late Mr Abernethie met with foul play - and also finds time to investigate the murder of a beneficiary under the new terms of the will. Whodunit, starring David Suchet, with Robert Bathurst, Anna Calder-Marshall and Geraldine James

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: Crime writer Ariadne Oliver (My Family's Zoe Wanamaker) and four known killers are among those who meet Poirot at a bridge evening arranged by wealthy adventurer Shaitana, who sits out the first game - only to be found later stabbed through the heart. As nobody has left or entered the victim's apartment during the night, the guests combine their skills to discover which of the party is responsible. Whodunit, starring David Suchet, with Lesley Manville and Alex Jennings

programme.title: Foyle's War
programme.desc: As Foyle prepares to be replaced at the police station and begin retirement, his attention is grabbed by a news story about a man sentenced to hang for high treason, and he decides to take on the case. But with the prisoner's execution date approaching, the detective has to work fast to find evidence that will clear him. Meanwhile, Samantha and Adam fight to save Hill House from the town planners determined to demolish it - but disaster soon strikes. Starring Michael Kitchen, Honeysuckle Weeks and Max Brown

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When a woman is drowned in a bath and made to look like a bride, with a chilling lipstick message on the bathroom mirror, it triggers a spate of ghoulish wedding-themed murders in Great Worthy. The case takes Barnaby and Jones to a donkey sanctuary, a heritage steam railway and a pub run by an ex-policeman and former brothel madam as they try to identify the killer. Guest starring Pam Ferris (Rosemary & Thyme) and Kacey Ainsworth (formerly EastEnders' Little Mo)

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Bullard asks Barnaby to investigate the disappearance of a friend's daughter who was a member of the Oblong Foundation, a cult based at Malham Hall. Jones goes under cover as a new recruit to solve the mystery, but he and Barnaby soon start digging into an old case involving the death of a couple in a boat explosion, which could be linked to the missing woman. Detective drama, starring Neil Dudgeon and Jason Hughes, with Will Knightley, Kevin Doyle, Holly Aird, Barbara Flynn and John Woodvine

programme.title: Van Der Valk
programme.desc: The detective and his team investigate when a classical musician and former musical child prodigy dies after being the victim of an acid attack, asking if the intention was to maim and disfigure, or to kill. As the incident took place in a crowded concert hall foyer with numerous witnesses, was the attacker trying to send a message?

programme.title: Scott & Bailey
programme.desc: Dorothy becomes concerned her grand-daughter Taisie is being influenced by Rachel, while Janet is mortified when Gill berates her for inappropriate behaviour toward young sergeant Rob. The detective duo are sent to investigate the death of a man in a nursing home after his daughter complains about the level of care he had been receiving. Will they find any evidence of foul play? Detective drama, starring Lesley Sharp, Suranne Jones and Danny Miller

Those who fail to impress undertake a second challenge in a fight for survival. To prove their business acumen, they must devise a 30 lunch menu and run a busy Langham lunch service. Tension overflows in the kitchen and the chef who brings in the least profit is eliminated. Michel Roux Jr, Ravneet Gill and Mike Reid judge their efforts

programme.title: Britain's Most Expensive Houses
programme.desc: Documentary following the brokers at UK Sotheby's International Realty. The super prime property market is booming and competition to court ultra-high-net-worth individuals with money to spend is fierce. This programme features a grade I listed terraced home for sale overlooking Regents Park Lake. Built in 1822 and designed by renowned Regency architect John Nash, it's worth an eye-watering 29million, making it one of the most expensive homes in the UK. Also in London, managing director of UK Sotheby's International Realty Guy is invited to sell a rather unusual houseboat boasting five bedrooms and three bathrooms

programme.title: 24 Hours in Police Custody
programme.desc: Concluding the investigation into the 1994 murder of six-year-old Rikki Neave. Fifteen years after Rikki's mother was cleared of his murder following a flawed police investigation, a team of dedicated officers from the Major Crime Unit of Cambridgeshire police were authorised to begin a fresh investigation. Analysis of the evidence put a new suspect, James Watson, who was 13 at the time of the killing, together with Rikki on the day of his disappearance. But despite a forensic breakthrough, Watson presented the officers with a conundrum that made it difficult to prove the case against him

programme.title: Moors Murders
programme.desc: Analysis of never-before-seen letters from Ian Brady and Myra Hindley, written over their five decades in prison, and personal accounts from those who knew them. The first episode features an eyewitness account of the last murder from Myra Hindley's brother-in-law David Smith, and contributions from 1960s pop singer Janie Jones, who befriended Hindley in prison and conducted a 40-year-long correspondence with both Hindley and Brady

programme.title: Untold: Addicted to Drip
programme.desc: A lifestyle traditionally associated with ultra-high-net-worth individuals is increasingly being pursued by 16 to 34-year-olds. Exclusive figures reveal that almost half of younger Brits have gone into debt after purchasing a luxury item. Presenter and comedian David Whitely, aka Sideman, meets people who've lost tens of thousands in the pursuit of luxury. However, while the need to be stylish or fashionable (that is having the 'drip') is getting some into financial trouble, he finds that for others it is opening doors

programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer look back at favourite editions featuring homes full of collections and clutter. In Somersham, Kris and Emily have a 50,000 budget for a first-floor extension to add a fourth bedroom, which Kris thinks will sway Emily back to loving it. But Kirstie is convinced they already have the space they need and embarks on her biggest-ever declutter. They also travel to the Edinburgh suburb of Portobello, where Gary and Bill are at loggerheads over their 19th-century home which is full of Bill's music memorabilia

programme.title: The Pennines: Backbone of Britain
programme.desc: An exploration of the mountain range and the people who live there. The first episode comes from the Peak District National Park, a popular destination for climbers. The area is also a vital water catchment that supplies the neighbouring industrial towns and cities. In the northern part of the Peak District, not far from Sheffield, is a reservoir called Ladybower - a place synonymous with the Dambusters Raid

programme.title: Channel 4 News

programme.title: A Royal Guide To
programme.desc: Behind the scenes at royal wedding celebrations, occasions that tread a fine line between the traditional and personal. programme.title: Britain's Most Luxurious Train Journeys

programme.title: Ancient Egypt by Train with Alice Roberts

programme.title: First Man (2018)

Director Damien Chazelle's Oscar-winning drama based on the book by James R Hansen, starring Ryan Gosling and Claire Foy

programme.desc: Ben spends a year following Alan and Yvonne as they risk everything to start a holiday lodge business in a remote part of Scotland, with no experience of running a building project or a business, and live in a home they bought online during lockdown without ever setting foot in it. Ben meets them after they get the keys to their new house and see it in the flesh for the first time. Before the pair can even start building the lodges for their business, they need sell their old house in Crawley, and Yvonne has to spend the school year teaching down south and living apart from Alan, who moves to Scotland first

programme.title: Ben Fogle: New Lives in the Wild
programme.desc: Ben journeys to the Suffolk countryside and a secretive patch of woodland, to spend the week with unique character Will, 50, who could be described as a true British caveman. Ben embraces Will's Stone Age-style existence in the forest and discovers how a childhood passion carved Will's future, the price he paid for following his dream, and how he is steering it back around as Ben meets him at a new stage in his prehistoric life

programme.title: The Blackouts of '74: When Britain Went Dark
programme.desc: Archive footage and celebrity recollections reveal how 50 years ago during an energy crisis the government imposed a three-day working week for factories, shops and business, and UK-wide household blackouts. Contributors including Billy Brag, Michael Heseltine, Trevor McDonald, Pete Waterman, Diane Jordan and Fern Britton reflect on their own experiences of the blackouts back in 1974

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses: Britain's Favourite Sitcom

There are also contributions from the crew, and insight into how such iconic comedy moments were devised and executed, including the chandelier scene, and the much-loved bar fall

programme.title: Secrets of the Royal Palaces
programme.desc: Kate Williams explores the history of Sandringham in Norfolk, which is one of the few royal residences owned personally by the Windsors. It was purchased in 1861 for the rakish Prince Edward in the hopes he would settle down in the countryside, but instead he turned it into the perfect party palace, with a bowling alley, billiards and endless hunting and shooting. The historian also reveals how Prince Philip once proposed demolishing the place to make way for a more modern replacement, before being forced to relent by the Queen Mother

programme.title: Birds of a Feather: 30 Years of Laughs

programme.title: Noel Edmonds: The Rise & Fall of Mr Saturday Night

Starting out at Radio Luxembourg, Edmonds reached his peak with Noel's House Party and Mr Blobby in the 1990s, but failed personal ventures led to his disappearance from the nation's screens until he made a comeback with Deal or No Deal in 2005

programme.desc: A world-weary man embarks on a unique odyssey of self-discovery, attempting to reach home by swimming in the neighbourhood pools along the way. Director Frank Perry's cult drama, starring Burt Lancaster, Kim Hunter and Janice Rule

programme.title: Picnic (1955)
programme.desc: A drifter turns up in a small American town looking for a well-off old friend in the hope of borrowing money. However, he causes nothing but trouble for the locals, seducing both his old pal's fiancee and a local schoolteacher. Drama based on William Inge's Pulitzer Prize-winning play, starring William Holden, Cliff Robertson and Kim Novak

programme.title: Hobson's Choice (1953)
programme.desc: A cantankerous, overbearing boot-maker spends most of his time drinking while his three daughters push themselves to the limit taking care of his shop and home. A timid employee marries one of the sisters, then sets himself up as a rival for his business. Comedy, starring John Mills and Charles Laughton

programme.title: The Hound of the Baskervilles (1959)
programme.desc: Sherlock Holmes and Dr Watson are asked to protect the last remaining member of the aristocratic Baskerville family, who is believed to be the target of a monstrous spectral hound roaming the remote Devon moors. Hammer version of Arthur Conan Doyle's mystery, starring Peter Cushing, Andre Morrell, Christopher Lee, John Le Mesurier and Miles Malleson

programme.title: Addams Family Values (1993)
programme.desc: Spooky couple Gomez and Morticia hire a nanny to look after their new baby son - and stop him suffering an early death at the hands of his jealous elder siblings. Romance soon blossoms between the new childminder and Uncle Fester, but he does not realise she is planning to kill him once she has got hold of the family fortune. Comedy sequel, starring Anjelica Huston, Raul Julia, Christopher Lloyd, Christina Ricci and Joan Cusack

programme.title: Olympus Has Fallen (2013)
programme.desc: A secret service operative is reassigned from Presidential Protection after a tragic accident. As he prepares to leave his assignment, terrorists take control of the White House and hold the president hostage. The agent is trapped in the building, and uses his inside knowledge to rescue the head of state. Action thriller, starring Gerard Butler, Aaron Eckhart and Morgan Freeman

programme.title: Anais In Love (2021)
programme.desc: Anas is an aspiring writer who's procrastinating on completing her doctorate. She's had it with her boyfriend, so she barges into an affair with publisher Daniel. And when that disappoints her, she moves on to his partner, writer Emilie. Romantic comedy drama, starring Anas Demoustier. In French, with English subtitles

programme.title: Can You Ever Forgive Me? (2018)
programme.desc: While suffering financial troubles, writer Lee Israel starts forging and selling letters by dead celebrities, incorporating intimate details to command high prices. She also starts stealing authentic letters from libraries and archives to sell, replacing them with forged duplicates. Comedy, starring Oscar nominees Melissa McCarthy and Richard E Grant

programme.title: Winchester '73 (1950)
programme.desc: A gunslinger tracks down his father's killer, but is unable to exact his revenge because the sheriff of the town makes a point of confiscating all firearms. Instead he challenges him to compete in a shooting competition to win a superb rifle, but when the murderer loses, he steals the coveted prize. Western, starring James Stewart, Shelley Winters, Dan Duryea and Stephen McNally

programme.title: A Town Like Alice (1956)
programme.desc: Second World War PoW Jean Paget is sent on a gruelling forced march between Japanese labour camps, but finds comfort in her friendship with Australian captive Joe Harman. During the journey Joe is caught stealing, tied to a cross and left to die. After the conflict is over, Jean is startled to receive a letter postmarked in Joe's home town of Alice Springs. Jack Lee's drama, based on the novel by Nevil Shute, starring Virginia McKenna, Peter Finch, Takagi and Jean Anderson

programme.title: Ice Cold in Alex (1958)
programme.desc: The crew and passengers of an ambulance become stranded in the Libyan desert and face a perilous journey back to civilisation. Leading the trek is an alcoholic army captain, who vows to remain sober until he has completed the task - but his resolve is threatened by a stranger they rescue who is secretly an enemy spy. Second World War drama, with John Mills, Sylvia Syms, Anthony Quayle and Harry Andrews

programme.title: Transformers: The Last Knight (2017)
programme.desc: The shape-changing robots and their human allies face a confrontation with their original creator, who has brainwashed their leader and intends to save her own home planet by destroying Earth. To save the human race they must recover an ancient artefact from Arthurian legend - but their mission is threatened by old enemies as they uncover a terrible secret about the history of the world. Sci-fi adventure sequel, starring Mark Wahlberg, Anthony Hopkins, Gemma Chan, Stanley Tucci and John Turturro

programme.title: London Has Fallen (2016)
programme.desc: World leaders gather in London for the funeral of the British Prime Minister, unaware they have been led into a trap. A terrorist plans to kill them all, and devastate the city, and the only people in a position to stop him are the President of the United States and the indomitable head of his secret service. Action thriller sequel to Olympus Has Fallen, starring Gerard Butler, Aaron Eckhart and Morgan Freeman

programme.title: The Intruder (2019)
programme.desc: A young married couple buy a beautiful house on several acres of land, only to find out that the man they bought it from refuses to let go of the property. Mystery horror, starring Michael Ealy, Meagan Good and Dennis Quaid

programme.title: Thoroughbreds (2017)
programme.desc: Two upper-class Connecticut teenagers rekindle their unlikely friendship after years of growing apart, and hatch a plan to solve their problems, no matter what the cost. Comedy crime drama, starring Olivia Cooke, Anya Taylor-Joy and Anton Yelchin

programme.title: Marmaduke (2010)
programme.desc: An advertising executive tries to start a new life in California with his family and their lumbering, disaster-prone Great Dane. The friendly but clumsy dog accidentally causes chaos for his owners, until an incident at a surfing competition makes him a local celebrity. Comedy, with Lee Pace, and featuring the voice of Owen Wilson

programme.title: A Shot in the Dark (1964)
programme.desc: The bungling Inspector Clouseau is sent to investigate a high-profile murder case. All the clues point to a maid being the guilty party, but the accident-prone detective is instantly smitten with her, and devotes his efforts to proving her innocence - despite all evidence to the contrary. Comedy, starring Peter Sellers, Elke Sommer, George Sanders and Herbert Lom

programme.title: The Chronicles of Narnia: The Voyage of the Dawn Treader (2010)
programme.desc: Lucy and Edmund Pevensie return to the magical world accompanied by their selfish cousin. They join their old friend King Caspian as he sets sail across the sea in search of seven of his father's allies who had been banished years before, but along the way they discover an evil force is growing in strength. Fantasy adventure, with Georgie Henley, Skandar Keynes, Will Poulter and Ben Barnes

programme.title: Jumanji (1995)
programme.desc: A man who has been trapped inside a mysterious jungle board game for 26 years is eventually freed when two children start to play it. Unfortunately, he arrives with a rampaging horde of animals on his heels, leaving only one solution - to finish the game he started all those years ago. Fantasy adventure, starring Robin Williams, Kirsten Dunst and Bonnie Hunt

programme.title: My Spy (2020)
programme.desc: Special Forces operative turned spy JJ undertakes covert surveillance of Kate Newton, the sister-in-law of a terrorist. JJ is ordered to keep a low profile. Unfortunately, Kate's resourceful nine-year-old daughter Sophie blows his cover and blackmails JJ into training her as a spy. Comedy, starring Dave Bautista and Chloe Coleman

programme.title: Angel Has Fallen (2019)
programme.desc: Secret Service agent Mike Banning finds himself framed for an assassination attempt on the President. Pursued by his own agency and the FBI, Banning races to clear his name and uncover the real terrorist threat - which has set its sights on Air Force One. Action thriller sequel, starring Gerard Butler and Morgan Freeman

programme.title: No Looking Back (2021)
programme.desc: When Olga is released from prison after four years, she has one thing on her mind - getting her daughter, Masha back. But Olga's mother, Vera won't give Masha up easily. Comic crime thriller, starring Viktoriya Korotkova and Anna Mikhalkova. In Russian, with English subtitles

programme.title: Blair Witch (2016)
programme.desc: Twenty years have passed since the victims of the Blair Witch disappeared in the woods in Maryland, with James still wondering what happened to his sister Heather. When he discovers eerie Internet footage of someone resembling her, he and three friends set out to investigate, taking along cameras to document their search. Horror sequel, starring James Allen McCune, Callie Hernandez, Brandon Scott, Valorie Curry, Corbin Reid and Wes Robinson

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Yazz finds herself having second thoughts and decides to try and tell Tom her true feelings. Later, Joel helps Leela take her mind off everything

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Grace calls off the robbery but Cindy is determined, even if she has to do it alone. Yazz returns from the hospital, and Charlie is overcome by paranoia

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay is in Redondo Beach, California, for the first of two visits to Zayna Flaming Grill, a Mediterranean restaurant owned and run by aunt and niece Faye and Brenda. Faye believes she has the weight of the entire restaurant on her shoulders, while Brenda feels she isn't treated as an equal in the business. With tensions rising, the food not up to scratch and everyone playing the blame game, the chef is faced with one of the trickiest situations he's ever encountered

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay concludes his visit to Zayna Flaming Grill in Redondo Beach, California, and finds more questions than answers as he tries to save the crisis-ridden restaurant from disaster. While trying to inject some much-needed flavour into the tired Mediterranean menu, the chef also encourages aunt-and-niece duo Faye and Brenda to settle their differences

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay revisits three restaurants he helped that were among the biggest challenges he faced, finding out whether they stayed on the road to recovery or turned back into nightmares. First he meets sisters Rita and Lisa to see if they have continued serving fresh instead of frozen food at Boston's La Galleria 33, before heading to the Olde Hitching Post in Hanson, Massachusetts, to discover whether controlling owner Tom has kept his promise and handed over the reins to his daughter Andrea. So, when bride-to-be Beccie gives him free rein to plan their wedding, he decides to honour them - and not her - with nuptials based on the rare grooves of Northern Soul. Will this groom be able to deliver a swinging day, or will his bride be swinging wildly at him?

programme.title: Tad the Lost Explorer and the Secret of King Midas (2017)
programme.desc: Awkward explorer Tad Stones must rescue his beloved Sara from a millionaire who is looking for King Midas's necklace. Animated adventure, with the voices of Trevor White and Alex Kelly

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Part one of two. Gordon Ramsay comes to the aid of Mangia Mangia, an Italian restaurant with an identity crisis in Woodland Park, Colorado, where guests have a choice between casual fine-dining service or a pick-up from the drive-through takeaway. Hard-nosed owner Julie finds herself completely at odds with the head chef, forcing her to breaking point

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay concludes his two-part challenge at Mangia Mangia in Woodland Park, Colorado. In order to save the struggling Italian restaurant from disaster, he must persuade harassed owner Julie to co-operate with the head chef, and work his magic on a menu that relies heavily on a microwave

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay is in Redondo Beach, California, for the first of two visits to Zayna Flaming Grill, a Mediterranean restaurant owned and run by aunt and niece Faye and Brenda. Faye believes she has the weight of the entire restaurant on her shoulders, while Brenda feels she isn't treated as an equal in the business. With tensions rising, the food not up to scratch and everyone playing the blame game, the chef is faced with one of the trickiest situations he's ever encountered

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay concludes his visit to Zayna Flaming Grill in Redondo Beach, California, and finds more questions than answers as he tries to save the crisis-ridden restaurant from disaster. While trying to inject some much-needed flavour into the tired Mediterranean menu, the chef also encourages aunt-and-niece duo Faye and Brenda to settle their differences

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: The Emmy-winning comedy returns - as do Cameron and Mitchell, who are back from honeymoon and determined to keep the romance alive. Cameron, however, takes it just a little step too far. The Dunphys, meanwhile, have been enjoying a relaxing summer without smart-alec Alex, who is away on a trip - although she threatens to rock the boat after arriving home early - and Gloria shows a different side after arguing with Jay about the lack of effort he puts into his appearance

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Jay and Gloria celebrate their anniversary, but cannot decide on what kind of gift to give each other. Meanwhile, the Dunphys join Alex on her college tour and Phil, Luke and Haley find themselves in a mirrored waiting room with a button and a sign that says 'Do Not Push'. Comedy, starring Ed O'Neill and Julie Bowen

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Phil comes across footage of an incriminating sneeze while looking at Cameron and Mitchell's wedding video that proves he is responsible for the family's flu epidemic, so he sets about getting rid of the proof with the help of Luke and some creative editing. Claire struggles to make it through an important business meeting while feeling under the weather, while Cam is forced to make a difficult decision when it comes to Manny and the school football team. Mitch meets Lily's know-it-all friend and male nanny Andy (Andy DeVine) makes a welcome return

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: The Dunphys move into a hotel while their house is being treated for mould, but when they are forced to share a single room, cabin fever soon sets in. Gloria worries after finding out that Manny is dating one of the popular girls at school, while Cam's attempt to keep his football team's unprecedented winning streak going is threatened by a 'cursed' Mitchell

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: The Dunphys are sent into a panic when a loud, obnoxious couple come to look at the house next door. Jay is furious to learn that Manny is dating the granddaughter of his biggest business rival, while Mitch and Cam take on Lily's tyrannical teacher, Mrs Plank. Steve Zahn and Andrea Anders join the cast as new neighbours Ronnie and Amber, with guest star Tyne Daly

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Raj's parents set him up on a blind date in the hope of initiating an arranged marriage, but after a promising start it becomes apparent that the girl in question is more interested in Sheldon. Meanwhile, Penny begins her new job as a bartender. Starring Kunal Nayyar and Jim Parsons

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard and Sheldon receive an invitation to present their research to a physics conference, but Sheldon's reluctance to pander to his peers causes conflict between the friends. An intervention by Penny makes matters worse. Johnny Galecki and Jim Parsons star

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon and Leonard invent excuses to avoid having to attend Penny's performance in a production of the stage musical Rent, but maintaining the pretence makes matters increasingly complicated. Johnny Galecki, Simon Helberg and Kaley Cuoco star, with DJ Qualls

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon falls ill, and his friends decide to go to a Planet of the Apes movie marathon to keep their distance, knowing he will be in a terrible mood. However, an unsuspecting Penny offers to nurse him. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Simon Helberg and Kaley Cuoco

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon feels threatened by a 15-year-old physics prodigy who is even cleverer than he is, and asks Leonard to help him discredit the precocious teenager's research. Johnny Gale and Jim Parsons star

programme.title: Puss in Boots (2011)
programme.desc: The swashbuckling feline joins forces with a cunning thief and a treacherous old friend to steal a magical golden goose from a giant's castle. He must save the day when it transpires that their actions have unleashed a terrible danger on his home town. Animated comedy spin-off from the Shrek movies, with the voices of Antonio Banderas and Salma Hayek

programme.title: The Great Celebrity Bake Off for Stand Up to Cancer

The contestants must take on three tricky challenges - a sandwich biscuit for the signature round, a sweet bread-based technical, and a cake showstopper which reveals their favourite guilty pleasure

Shows including including American Pie, The Graham Norton Show, Love Island, Natural World - Walrus: Two Tonne Tusker, Killing Eve, Blind Date, Jeremy Wade's Dark Waters, and The Family Brain Game come under their gaze. programme.title: Gogglebox

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: At 90, Raymon is the oldest dater to visit the restaurant. His fellow diner is ballroom dancing enthusiast Cecelia, who's searching of a glitzy gent to sweep her off her feet. Cameras also follow brickie-turned-model Frankie, who is on the hunt for his perfect 'Barbie'. On first impressions, glamorous PA Rosie certainly fits the bill, but can he charm her?

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Teaching assistant and burlesque performer Susie, 32, hopes to overcome her dating nerves and stutter to find her 'Prince Charming'. Her date is Star Trek fan Martin from Essex, while 30-year-old hairdresser Bonnie hopes semi-pro boxer Perry is the man for her. However, it remains to be seen if Cupid's arrow strikes any of them

programme.title: Kirstie's House of Craft
programme.desc: Lucy Alexander and Martin Roberts go head to head as they create iced ombre cakes, and Mark-Francis Vandelli and Aggie MacKenzie battle it out with intricate jelly art

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Shirley has been holidaying in Spain for over a decade, but now wants to make a permanent move to the area around Los Alczares in Spain's Murcia region. She brings along her best friend and sister to help her make this life-changing move, enlisting property expert Laura Hamilton to use the 50,000 budget available to find the ideal place for her to settle

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: In France, the alpaca farmers take the herd to a chateau and the gtes get their first guests. In Spain, the padel tennis club flourishes and in Italy, a project nears completion

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien travel Britain to find items to fix up and flog on to make a handsome profit for their owners. Simon recycles some historic oak, while Henry comes unstuck when he tries to get to grips with an old Ford Escort

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole gives Simon O'Brien a motorcycling masterclass in Wiltshire as the duo seek more items to fix up and sell on to make profits for their owners

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: A search in Lancashire uncovers a family hero who flew Wellington bombers during the First World War, and investigators stumble across a mysterious disappearance from the 1960s

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The home of a retired lift attendant from Leeds goes under the hammer at auction and the team are hoping for a good profit to pass on to any heirs they can find. As they unravel the family tree, they discover that one of her grandfathers rose from groom to coachman to chauffeur as horse-driven vehicles were replaced by turn-of-the-century mechanisation

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition kicks off in Falmouth, Cornwall, where Gaye Woods hopes her family run Meudon Hotel will win the day. However, guests Tim and Mikey think their twin beds are too close for comfort. For some afternoon fun, Gaye lays on some oyster shucking. At dinner, some of the group are unconvinced by the high room rates and at breakfast, guests Sue and Chris reveal a picky streak. When Gaye receives her feedback, she's left wanting answers

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to the Royal Oak pub in Malborough, Devon, run by laid-back owner Tim Heap, with help from his barman Mikey Martindale. The basic rooms are a hit with some guests, but Geoff and Joan discover a mucky corner cupboard. Tim and Mikey take the group to an art workshop for some creative fun. At dinner, the guests are itching to know more about Tim's past and he doesn't disappoint, but he's riled when Gaye questions his unconventional management style. Following some unwanted extras at breakfast, some tough feedback makes Tim suspicious

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit is to the Angel Guest House in Tiverton, Devon, where owners Chris and Sue Holliday have created a homespun experience. Gaye is concerned by the noise of the road outside, and Joan and Geoff question some design choices in their room. During an afternoon playing a local game known as Throw the Egg, the group rumbles how competitive their hosts are. At dinner, Tim's enthusiasm results in an unexpected gift. Egg connoisseur Chris's poached eggs are put to the test at breakfast

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The fourth visit is to Geoff Jones and Joan McGowan's Compton Swan in Newbury, Berkshire. Expectations are high after Joan revealed she was named Ireland's Businesswoman of the Year on the last visit, but Tim, who's still smarting from his feedback, goes to town on his room. Tensions mount during an afternoon on an inflatable racecourse, where Chris and Sue try to sabotage the race. Geoff and Joan impress with a harpist at dinner and hearts are softened when they reveal the personal sacrifices they make for their business. At breakfast, Geoff the chef impresses, but egg-man Chris takes issues with his food

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final day in the competition sees the B&B owners meet for the last time to find out what they have been paid and settle some scores

programme.title: Escape to the Chateau
programme.desc: Angel transforms the attic into a studio and storage space for her vintage treasures and takes Dorothy on a trip to Paris, while Dick has his own plans for repurposing some ancient tools he finds in the outbuildings. The couple throws a surprise birthday celebration for Angel's mother, where Dick's purpose-built open-fire popcorn maker is put to the test

programme.title: The Dog House
programme.desc: Lonesome teenager Jasmine seeks a canine companion to replace her twin sister Shola, who's leaving her to start a university course. Her family thinks that pedigree beagle Zoe will make the perfect new sibling, but Jasmine isn't so sure. Elsewhere, staff of Woodgreen animal charity believe Jim the poodle could prove the perfect match for 12-year-old Lexi, who is looking for a 'bedtime buddy'

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud meets Mark and Candida Diacono, who have set about building a home in the shape of a plough on their 17-acre smallholding in Devon. With its complex curved roof, timber-clad exterior and steel-framed working barn, the ambitious project presents a unique technical challenge for a local builder and his team of employees, and the task proves even more intimidating when considering Mark and Candida hope to complete work on the build within seven months

programme.title: The Great British Dig: History in Your Back Garden
programme.desc: Hugh Dennis heads a team excavating back gardens around Britain. Joined by archaeological scientist and lecturer at Newcastle University Dr Chloe Duckworth, field archaeologist Natasha Bilson, and author and archaeologist John Henry Phillips, he reveals a new chapter of Roman history in Cornwall, at a recently discovered Roman fort near Calstock. Little was previously known about the Romans in this part of England, but the indications from the team's excavation are that the Romans were not in the south west solely for a military campaign. Hugh also visits the reconstructed Lunt Roman Fort in Coventry

programme.title: George Clarke's Remarkable Renovations
programme.desc: Architect George Clarke visits Three Ways Farm near Stockport, which has been in Gordon's family since the 1950s. His late mother's dream was for Gordon to turn the 120-year-old cattle shed and milking parlour into a home for himself, so he and partner Lisa have set out to make that a reality, creating their first home together. Will it end up being something his mother would have been proud of?

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: A teenager has a life-threatening bleed on the brain and requires emergency surgery, a 10-year-old gymnast sustains an injury to her wrist after performing a back bend, and a girl is brought in to the urgent care centre, needing treatment for her swollen tonsils. As they undergo treatment, their parents share stories of family life

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Laura Hamilton helps Marianne and Anthony from West Yorkshire search for their perfect holiday home in the Axarquia region of southern Spain

programme.title: Kirstie's House of Craft
programme.desc: TV presenter Anneka Rice and pop star Cheryl Baker go head to head as they each create a pair of leather earrings in the timed challenge, and TV personality Jo Wood takes on broadcaster Natasha Kaplinsky in a pyrography craft-off

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Babak and Alison from Barnsley are planning a permanent move to Almeria in southern Spain. The couple want to head inland and focus their search around the host of pretty towns and villages this mountainous region has to offer. Danni Menzies has five options within their maximum budget of 145,000, but will any of them match the pair's expectations of a dream home?

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: The season winds down at the alpaca farm in France, where two expats have added a glamping tent. At the gtes in Creuse, a dormouse causes a scare and renovations are done in Italy

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien visit the Cotswolds and Somerset, where finds include a set of milk churns and an old munitions shell

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: Two London properties go under the hammer on a high-value case. However, before any heirs can inherit the proceeds the team needs to work out who the deceased was. With two names to research it's a tricky case of vested interest

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The team investigates a competitive case based in Dorset and use the newly released 1939 register to help unlock a family tree. Their search turns up an uncle of the deceased who was once a naval policeman and as they scour other censuses they discover more and more hidden family members

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition starts at the Brighton Surf hotel, where Jeremy and Elena Mann hope their hands-off hosting style will win the approval of their guests

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Escape to the Chateau
programme.desc: Angel redesigns the rooms in one of the chateau's turrets with a fruits and flowers motif - but an unexpected surprise lurks behind her creations. Outside, Dick is putting together a parkour fitness trail in the 12 acres of grounds, but hits upon an unexpected obstacle buried deep underground

programme.title: The Dog House
programme.desc: Olympic cyclist Victoria Pendleton visits Woodgreen animal charity, keen to find a dog she can co-parent with her mother. She meets Leilo, but the Rhodesian ridgeback's long-term medical needs require serious consideration. Lovebirds Shai and Orin's try to hit it off with Polo the lurcher, while Zoe the beagle meets the Forristal family

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud meets Tom and Danielle Raffield, whose lifelong passion has been steam-bending wood. They've used the technique to create extraordinary furniture and lighting, but now plan to use it on a larger scale. In an attempt to escape the confines of their tiny gamekeeper's lodge, they have decided to build a wavy wooden house in South Cornwall, completed with curved cladding, twisted furniture and interior walls covered with weathered timber. With a 100,000 budget, the pair have decided to do a lot of the building themselves, and Kevin is on hand to discover whether they're up to the challenge

programme.title: I Killed My Husband
programme.desc: Anna doesn't know if she can trust Laure, even though they still have a bond. She wants to take Louis and get away from everyone, including the police. However, Guillot is set on to undermining Anna's chances. In French

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: A 75-year-old man who fell out of bed is suspected of having a stroke, and doctors have only a short window of time to administer a life-saving, clot-busting drug. A mother of two falls off her horse, and a six-year-old girl has a possible neck injury after an accident in the playground. Family members of the patients share their personal stories

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Mark, 32, is brought to resus with a head injury after having an epileptic seizure, and he is sent for an urgent CT scan to assess the damage to his brain. Anastasia, 80, comes to urgent care with a pain in her leg and while she is sent for an X-ray to rule out a blood clot, she shares the story of her arrival to study in England from Nigeria, only for civil war to break out back home. Porter Chris, who's been part of the A&E department for 25 years, shares his insights into the job as he goes about his day

programme.title: A Place in the Sun

Danni Menzies finds five options for their 120,000 budget, but will any wow them enough to want to put in an offer?

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Jimmy Doherty, Kate Quilton and Matt Tebbutt unveil more secrets about the world of mass-produced food. Jimmy heads to the US to find out how the big chunks in American ice-cream stay so crispy, Kate investigates a rise in olive oil prices and finds a disease wiping out olive trees in southern Italy, and Matt discovers why Bloody Marys are so popular on planes - and why airline food tastes very different at ground level

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Sylvia and Martin from Lancashire have been visiting Spain for many years and have now decided the time is right to buy their very own holiday home there to enjoy with their growing family. They have chosen Alora in the Malaga province of southern Spain for its tradition atmosphere and beautiful surrounding countryside. With a budget of 140,000 and Jasmine Harman's expertise on hand, can they find the holiday home of their dreams?

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin lines up five properties for Michael and his wife Jane from Sussex, who are looking for a holiday home within easy reach of the coast in Spain's Almeria province. They have a budget of 90,000 and dream of finding a traditional property with modern features that the whole family can enjoy

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Phil Spencer catches up with two sets of discerning house-hunters, each with very strong ideas on what they wanted. The searches may have been tough - in some instances they didn't even make it inside some of the properties - but both have faced even more challenging times since. In 2012, couple Robin and Colin wanted to move outside of London, but only an architectural gem was going to do. In 2014, Lia and Andrew said they were done renting in London's popular Isle of Dogs, and wanted to buy their own home now they were starting a family

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Phil Spencer and Kirstie Allsopp catch up with house hunters who were looking for their dream family home. Chae and Corinna had their hearts set on finding something perfect in Fife, while single mother Jo Beck wanted a permanent home for herself and her two children in Derby

programme.title: Car S.O.S.
programme.desc: Tim and Fuzz take on a 1993 Toyota Supra Mk4 owned by former motorcycle racer Lisa. Her family hope the restored car will lift her spirits after a terrible accident

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Sports fanatic James Cox hosts the first of the week's dinner parties in Northampton, and he is confident that his French-Italian menu will bag him the 1,000 prize. However, some of his guests - Barb Wiles, Donna Harris, Duncan Fielding and Caroline Nash - are left confused by his Vichyssoise soup starter, and the tiramisu causes one of them to choke

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Mother-of-three Donna Harris hosts the second dinner party in Northampton, and hopes that three courses of pure comfort-food will be enough to secure the 1,000 prize. Donna spends almost as much time fixing her make-up as she does preparing the meal, and when guests Duncan Fielding and Caroline Nash discover a secret stash of football shirts, they realise there is more to their hostess than meets the eye

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

However, the competitors are unnerved by her interest in extraterrestrials while snooping around her bedroom, and things go from bad to worse when a seafood starter and undercooked chicken result in tears at the dinner table

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Attention-loving businessman and keen cricketer Duncan Fielding takes centre stage in hosting the final dinner party from Northampton. He creates a menu based on the story of his life - which is full of surprises and full of spice - but it proves a challenge for three of his guests, who like their food mild. His main feature is a chicken and reindeer curry, and the table is impressed to discover that he runs a community pub from the bottom of his garden

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: No-nonsense bikers Wayne and Tracy Dunn arefirst to host at Llwyn Onn Guest House in Betws-y-Coed, north Wales. Former airline cabin crew assistant Nicola Ellershaw makes a less than sparkly discovery when she checks in. Wayne and Tracy challenge their guests to design biker leathers for their own gang, before Jon and Chelli Bean make a shock revelation about Jon's past. At breakfast, Gary Pesticcio challenges his hosts, which his competitors label as game playing, and at feedback time Wayne and Tracy have to face some home truths
