programme.desc: The second hosts of the week are newlywed hoteliers Jon and Chelli Bean from the Parkwood Hotel in Stockton-on-Tees

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third hosts of the week are Nicola Ellershaw and Mackenzie Griffey, who hope to impress with the stylish fare on offer at The Pug and Greyhound in Leicestershire

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The guests' final stay is at The Solar Strand Hotel in Crosskeys, Wales, where Gary Pesticcio and his daughter Naomi hope their hi-tech approach to hospitality will impress

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners meet for the last time to find out what they have been paid, and the atmosphere turns sour when Jon and Chelli Bean disagree with Gary and Naomi Pesticcio's thoughts on their facility. Plus, Nicola Ellershaw and Mackenzie Griffey of The Pug and Greyhound in Great Glen want to unlock the reasons why their rooms were described as being 'like prison cells'

programme.title: The Great British Dig: History in Your Back Garden
programme.desc: Hugh Dennis heads a team excavating back gardens around Britain. Joined by archaeological scientist and lecturer at Newcastle University Dr Chloe Duckworth, field archaeologist Natasha Bilson, and author and archaeologist John Henry Phillips, he reveals a new chapter of Roman history in Cornwall, at a recently discovered Roman fort near Calstock. Little was previously known about the Romans in this part of England, but the indications from the team's excavation are that the Romans were not in the south west solely for a military campaign. Hugh also visits the reconstructed Lunt Roman Fort in Coventry

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: The return of the documentary about life inside an A&E department, following patients treated in the same 24-hour period at St George's in south-west London. Fourteen-year-old Eduard is rushed in after falling from a swing and fracturing his ankle, while 62-year-old Rosina is treated having broken her wrist on the dancefloor at a family party. Paula is in Resus having been unable to take in food through her feeding tube and it is not only her health that is in danger, but also that of her unborn baby

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Forty-three-year-old Mohammad, who has motor neurone disease, is rushed to St George's with severe sepsis and doctors work to get the infection under control, while David has fallen 20 feet from a billboard and the trauma team is concerned that the 47-year-old has suffered life-changing injuries. Retired journalist Tom is in the urgent care centre after knocking his arm and his wife Eileen reveals how their plans have been turned upside down due to an unexpected bombshell six weeks previously

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown

programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May set out to discover if they can go motor racing for less than it costs to play golf. programme.title: Mortimer & Whitehouse: Gone Fishing
programme.desc: Paul Whitehouse and Bob Mortimer fly to Enniskillen, Co Fermanagh, to fish for pike, which eluded them in the previous series. They take to the waters of Lough Erne in their search for this mighty fish, guided by the very experienced Pascal. They discuss their respective bad habits and Bob gives Paul a thorough health update, before they retire to a local hostelry to sample traditional refreshments. Paul demonstrates how to perform life-saving CPR and Bob gives him a glimpse into his future by telling his fortune in an ancient Irish manner

programme.title: Mortimer & Whitehouse: Gone Fishing

programme.desc: How Russian scientists tried to create a human-ape hybrid in the 1920s. Plus, a mysterious airship crash and a disease outbreak that may have been caused by bio-weapon experiments

programme.title: Secrets of the London Underground
programme.desc: Tim Dunn and Siddy Holloway explore the abandoned branch line between Holborn and Aldwych, and at Holloway Road they find out about the Tube's only spiral escalator

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Armed with his trusty 1913 Bradshaw's Continental Railway Guide, Michael Portillo ventures east through Romania to the shores of the Black Sea. Along the way he encounters a bloodsucking vampire in Transylvania and brown bears in the Carpathian forest, before visiting a fairytale castle with modern conveniences in Sinaia, striking oil in Ploiesti, tapping into the nation's musical soul in Bucharest and loading cargo from a crane in Constanta. This leg of his journey ends at Constanta, where Michael explores what is now emerging as Europe's largest grain port

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo explores an Edwardian utopia in Letchworth, where he meets a fourth generation citizen who introduces him to the town's community spirit. He then heads towards London, and discovers a favoured haunt of King Edward VII, before sampling the monarch's favourite tipple, the King's Ginger

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo arrives in Croydon, where he hears the story of a mixed-race composer who was once celebrated but is now forgotten. At Three Bridges station, he is delighted to find a recently built depot and its fleet of new Class 700 trains - and is given the great honour of washing one down. In Lewes, he makes a beeline for Charleston, the home of artists Vanessa Bell and Duncan Grant, and in Shoreham-by-Sea, Michael discovers how magnificent Edwardians in flying machines took off from the oldest licensed airport in the country

programme.title: Bangers & Cash
programme.desc: A collection of Austin Mini Metros arrive for auction. Also going under the hammer is a baby Fiat 850 coupe and a haulier offloads part of his vintage commercial vehicle collection

programme.title: Bangers & Cash
programme.desc: There's an unlikely arrival at the North Yorkshire car auction - an Argentinian Army Mercedes G wagon that saw action in the Falklands War

programme.title: Narrow Escapes of World War II
programme.desc: A profile of Dudley Mason, who was awarded the George Cross after the tanker he was commanding came under attack during Operation Pedestal in August 1942 to relieve Malta

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo crosses the county line from Devon into Somerset, seeing first-hand how willow farmers sought to overcome the challenge from the production of synthetic plastics during the 1930s and hearing how tourism has spread across the region, especially amongst the young. In Bath, Michael visits the former home of a refugee emperor, whose country was invaded by the Italian dictator Mussolini, and in whose name a religious movement began that now flourishes worldwide. Travelling east into Wiltshire, he reaches the largest training area of the British Army, Salisbury Plain

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo explores the east of England in the inter-war period, starting in Canterbury, Kent, where he treads the boards as he uncovers the political message behind a 1936 play, inspired by the 12th-century murder of Archbishop Thomas a Becket. In Maidstone, he learns of the international origins of the most British symbol of remembrance. Outside Sevenoaks, Michael visits the country home of Winston Churchill, and discovers how the 1930s were wilderness years at Chartwell, as Churchill warned against Nazi appeasement. Once in the capital, he heads to Alexandra Palace, the birthplace of television

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Armed with his 1913 railway guide, Michael Portillo travels from the Swiss Alps to the shores of Lake Geneva. Along the way, he is caught up in a war zone with the Red Cross and rescued from an 'avalanche' by a St Bernard puppy. He takes to the skies in a vintage bi-plane to retrace the epic journey of the pioneering pilot who was first to fly over the Alps, and tries his hand at watchmaking, James Bond style

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo heads to Chichester, West Sussex, where he encounters an Edwardian motoring duo patronised by King Edward VII. After a grand tour of their factory, he is treated to some rest and relaxation in one of their finest vehicles. Arriving in the resort of Southsea, Hampshire, Michael heads for the King's Theatre, where he treads the boards in a community production of Lads in the Village. Crossing the Solent, the presenter boards the Island Line to travel along the pier in a 1930s London Underground carriage, then hops on to the Isle of Wight heritage line bound for Wootton

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: In Dorset, Michael Portillo visits Brownsea Island, where Robert Baden Powell began the scout movement in the early 20th century. Joining a group of present scouts, the presenter learns to build a bivouac and finds out what it is about scouting that still appeals to boys - and girls - today. In the New Forest, Michael searches out some unsung heroes of the First World War - the ponies who became war horses - and hears their story from a commoner who runs a stable and riding school. Then in Bournemouth, the one-time MP investigates a very British institution - the beach hut

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: The story of how a town established by Henry Ford in the 1920s has been left to rot in the Amazonian rainforest. Plus, Mysterious monoliths scattered over a Polish forest

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: An advanced German battleship that sank in a Norwegian fjord during the Second World War, the Miles Glacier Bridge in Alaska, and a mysterious concrete giant in Bulgaria

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Steered by his 1913 Bradshaw railway guide, Michael Portillo takes the train down the spine of Italy as he travels from Rome to Sicily. He begins by weaving among the capital city's landmarks on the back of a 1950s Vespa, before boarding the train south to Naples, where he finds out about the first railway to be built in the country, and ventures into the crater of Mount Vesuvius. He takes a detour to the island of Capri, before finishing his journey in the ancient hilltop town of Taormina

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo uses his 1913 copy of Bradshaw's Continental Railway Guide to explore Poland. He begins in the capital Warsaw, where he takes to the floor to dance to one of Chopin's polonaises with high-school students rehearsing for their leavers' ball, before discovering how the former industrial city of Lodz supplied the vast Russian empire of the early 20th century. He then heads to Poznan and rides one of the few remaining steam-powered commuter trains, visits a factory in Wroclaw that manufactures car bodies for locomotives, and ends his journey in Krakow, where he takes a tour in an iconic vehicle of the communist era

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo uses his 1913 copy of Bradshaw's Continental Railway Guide as he travels through Spain and Portugal. He begins in the city of La Coruna, where he examines the Celtic roots of the Galician people and tries to master the bagpipes, before meeting walkers from all over the world on the pilgrims' trail to Santiago de Compostela. Heading across the border to Porto, Michael finds out about the origins of Britain's long alliance with the Portuguese, and finishes his journey in the capital Lisbon

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo uses his 1913 copy of Bradshaw's Continental Railway Guide to venture beyond Europe as he travels through the Holy Land. He begins in Israel, learning about the Baha'i faith and how it spread to Britain in the Edwardian era, hearing the story of the origins of Tel Aviv, and visiting the Christian, Jewish and Muslim quarters of the capital Jerusalem. Michael then crosses the separation barrier between Jerusalem and the West Bank in the company of his Palestinian guide and meets the embroiderers of the Arab Women's Union in Bethlehem, before finishing his journey in the Negev desert

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo follows in the footsteps of Edwardian travellers to trace a route recommended in his Bradshaw's guide from the heart of France to the Mediterranean coast. His journey begins in Lyon, where he learns how the city got its gastronomic reputation, and takes instruction from a leading chef on making an omelette. In Avignon, he samples a glass of the region's famous wine Chateauneuf-du-Pape, before his journey ends at the Mediterranean port of Marseille, where he joins a pilot boat as it leads a supertanker to its berth

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Armed with his trusty 1913 Bradshaw's Continental Railway Guide, Michael Portillo travels east through the Balkans along the most exotic section of the route taken by the Orient Express. His journey begins in Sofia, capital of Bulgaria, and includes stops in the ancient city of Plovdiv, the region of Rumelia, and former capital of the Ottoman Empire Edirne. Arriving in Istanbul, Michael takes a trip on the Bosphorus - a much-coveted stretch of water - finds out about Turkish delight and travels along the Marmaray metro line, which connects European and Asian Istanbul via a tunnel beneath the Bosphorus

programme.title: One Foot in the Grave
programme.desc: The Meldrews return home from a dreary holiday to find the neighbours about to sell their house to a weirdo - and while Victor is busy moaning about everything under the sun, Margaret considers embarking on an affair. Comedy, starring Richard Wilson and Annette Crosbie

programme.desc: Bruce Crompton marks the 75th Anniversary of VE Day, sending rare German halftrack vehicles to partake in a battle re-enactment. In France, he seeks VE Day relics

programme.title: Combat Dealers
programme.desc: Bruce Crompton and his team, buy, repair and sell Second World War military gear, travelling the world in search of rare artefacts to restore and sell

programme.title: Supercar Showroom
programme.desc: Life inside a Yorkshire-based supercar salesroom in a unique location, just metres from Leeds East Airport runway

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: The Restorers
programme.desc: Metalworker Ted Edley and gilder Ruth Tappin transform an antique French Lily Chandelier. Meanwhile, Robin Johnson works on an Irish estate wardrobe that is falling apart

programme.title: Shed and Buried
programme.desc: Henry Cole and friends Fuzz Townshend and Guy Willison hit the road to find, buy and make a profit from the UK's abandoned automotive gems

programme.title: Shed and Buried
programme.desc: Henry Cole and friends Fuzz Townshend and Guy Willison hit the road to find, buy and make a profit from the UK's abandoned automotive gems

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Furniture experts, horologists, metal workers, ceramicists and upholsterers try to restore family heirlooms and treasured possessions to their former glory

programme.title: The Hotel Inspector
programme.desc: Alex Polizzi visits Horley near Gatwick to help Quasim, the owner, improve his ailing Surrey guesthouse. With 13 other B&Bs all battling for the same trade, he is struggling to make the monthly repayments. Alex can see the potential in Quasim's business, but curbing his expensive tastes to maximise profits turns out to be far from easy

programme.title: Expedition X
programme.desc: Phil and Jessica head to Lake Lanier, one of the deadliest lake in America, to uncover rumours of drownings and ghostly encounters

programme.title: Hunting Hitler
programme.desc: A key Nazi support point in Uruguay is investigated. Mike and Lenny review newly declassified Chilean files that reveal a secret plot to attack the United States

programme.title: Hunting Hitler
programme.desc: A team of international investigators conducts a definitive inquiry into the possibility that Adolf Hitler may have survived the conclusion of the Second World War, and escaped from Germany before he could be apprehended by Allied forces. The investigation is inspired by an FBI cold case from 70 years ago, which saw top US officials, including FBI director J Edgar Hoover, considering the possibility that the German Fuhrer's death may have been fabricated to give him a chance to flee from justice

programme.title: Nasa's Unexplained Files
programme.desc: An investigation into a strange discovery made by the Mars Curiosity rover, which could suggest an alien nuclear war took place there more than 300 million years ago

programme.title: Aussie Gold Hunters
programme.desc: The Poseidon Crew battle challenging terrain in the mountains of High Country Victoria. Promising signs could lead the Gold Devils to a million dollar pay day

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: Find out how graphene, the world's smallest car, force testers, and composite cars are made

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: Find out how LED tubes, chocolate peanut butter bars, and robotic medication dispensers are made

programme.title: Teleshopping

programme.title: Teleshopping

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Cleaner Louise Dee hosts the penultimate dinner party in west Lancashire and provides her guests with a Spanish-inspired menu and an 'old skool rave' before her rivals give their thoughts on the evening

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Contestants from Manchester compete for the cash prize of 1,000. Quirky couple Sophie and Lucas base their menu on the idea that looks can be deceptive. On the second night, Ruth and her husband Martin serve up a traditional romantic meal. They hope to inspire an atmosphere of love and sharing, and they're surprised by how much their guests get on board with the theme. Finally, Liverpudlian Ryan and his boyfriend Warren host a Mexican feast

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Sara Damergi meets recently divorced Rajula Jasani, who is ready for a fresh start and looks at what is on the market in and around the Spanish coastal town of Nerja. The property buyer plans to invest 100,000 in a second home that she can use with her twin sons and friends, and possibly relocate to in the future

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: A couple who are struggling to decide where they should relocate receive guidance. Graziella Clarke spent a year in Seville, southern Spain, during her time as a student, and would love to return to the city. However, her husband Robert is not so sure, and instead proposes a move to Dorset

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Scarlette Douglas helps Laura and Matt fulfil their dream of living in the Italian countryside of Tuscany. The couple have a budget of 180,000 and need room for their two children

programme.title: Sarah Beeny's New Country Lives
programme.desc: James and Jodie find out how to make their 17th-century farmhouse watertight while Emma and James take two alpacas paddling at the beach

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: The restorations and upcycles this time include tree stumps, a dolls' house and a yarn spinner

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Receptionist Anna Gibbons hosts the first party in Southampton, but her burlesque theme does not go down well with her guests. Food snob Greg Bell criticises Anna's decision to use packet pastry, but designer Darren Miller lightens the mood when he joins in with the evening's pole-dancing entertainment

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Kitchen designer Darren Miller hosts the second dinner in Southampton, throwing a 1990s rave-themed party. Despite feeling unwell, he ploughs ahead with preparations, but things get off to a bad start when Greg Bell decides to ignore the event's dress code. An unfortunately placed tattoo appears to put the diners off Darren's main course, and a mouldy raspberry found in the dessert looks set to ruin his chance of winning the competition

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Customer service adviser Greg Bell hosts the third dinner party of the week in Southampton, determined to educate his guests in the art of fine dining. However, after putting up with two days of constant criticism from the host, his fellow competitors are eager to pounce on any opportunity to mark him down

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Dock co-ordinator Tasha Whyte hosts the fourth dinner party in Southampton, hoping her simple menu with fun entertainment will ease the underlying tensions between some of the diners. However, the guests make a surprising discovery when snooping around Tasha's house, which leaves one of them in tears

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Tax officer and vegetarian Bijal Mehta hosts the final night of the competition in Southampton, and hopes to create the ultimate meat-free dinner - but some of her guests are disappointed by the menu. Following the meal, the winner of the 1,000 prize is announced

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Craig Rowe meets teacher Kirsty from Co Armagh, who is looking for a holiday home on the Canary Island of Lanzarote, showing her five properties within her budget of 120,000

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Craig and his daughter Holly are pooling their resources to buy a property in their favourite holiday destination - Majorca. They love the beach and the great outdoors and want to be as close to the coast as possible. With a budget of 180,000, Danni Menzies sets out to find their ideal property

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie and Phil catch up with two sets of first time buyers who took on the market with their help. Elly and Paul from Bristol enlisted Phil's help in 2015 in their hunt for a period home with two double bedrooms, a bit of character and some outside space for future cats. Phil managed to find one with a cat flap already installed for 25,000 under-budget, now he visits them at a different property to find they have upsized in more ways than one. Kirstie met Steph and Nick in 2018 who were looking to buy their first home together after seven years of living in their own parents houses. With hopes of finding a futureproof home for them to settle in to, Kirstie found them a property in Dennyloanhead that was perfect for them to make their own, she returns to find out just how that went

programme.title: Extraordinary Escapes with Sandi Toksvig
programme.desc: Sandi is joined by comedian Judi Love for a tour of the Lake District as they stay in the best staycation hideaways they can find. Starting at the Gaia Farmhouse by Ullswater, Judi enjoys the sights and sounds of the season and Sandi feels the heat when Judi cooks an exceedingly spicy take on cottage pie. The pair then head to the Lingholm Estate to stay in a unique boathouse that floats over a wild and stormy Derwentwater and go for a very choppy boat ride. The adventure concludes on the banks of Windermere in Grey Gables where Sandi and Judi unwind with some wine-time and homemade watercolour postcards

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share their opinions on what they have been watching during the week, with cameras capturing their instant reactions and the lively discussions that are prompted by the week's biggest and best shows

programme.title: Britain's Most Expensive Houses
programme.desc: Documentary following the brokers at UK Sotheby's International Realty. The super prime property market is booming and competition to court ultra-high-net-worth individuals with money to spend is fierce. This programme features a grade I listed terraced home for sale overlooking Regents Park Lake. Built in 1822 and designed by renowned Regency architect John Nash, it's worth an eye-watering 29million, making it one of the most expensive homes in the UK. Also in London, managing director of UK Sotheby's International Realty Guy is invited to sell a rather unusual houseboat boasting five bedrooms and three bathrooms

programme.title: 24 Hours in Police Custody
programme.desc: Concluding the investigation into the 1994 murder of six-year-old Rikki Neave. Fifteen years after Rikki's mother was cleared of his murder following a flawed police investigation, a team of dedicated officers from the Major Crime Unit of Cambridgeshire police were authorised to begin a fresh investigation. Analysis of the evidence put a new suspect, James Watson, who was 13 at the time of the killing, together with Rikki on the day of his disappearance. But despite a forensic breakthrough, Watson presented the officers with a conundrum that made it difficult to prove the case against him

programme.title: Catching a Killer
programme.desc: When elderly teacher Peter Farquhar was found dead at home in the village of Maids Moreton in 2015, it was sad and unexpected, but no one thought it suspicious. But 18 months later, when his neighbour Ann Moore-Martin also fell ill and died, the police decided to look again. They found that Ben Field, a would-be vicar and academic, had recently become part of both of their lives and benefited from their wills. This programme shows that by delving back in time through friends' and loved ones' memories of Peter and Ben's relationship, as well as Peter's diary, the police discovered a story of love and betrayal

programme.title: Moors Murders
programme.desc: Analysis of never-before-seen letters from Ian Brady and Myra Hindley, written over their five decades in prison, and personal accounts from those who knew them. The first episode features an eyewitness account of the last murder from Myra Hindley's brother-in-law David Smith, and contributions from 1960s pop singer Janie Jones, who befriended Hindley in prison and conducted a 40-year-long correspondence with both Hindley and Brady

programme.title: 60 Days on the Estates
programme.desc: Ed Stafford heads to the Easterhouse estate, six miles east of Glasgow city centre, and discovers that the cost-of-living crisis has hit the locals hard. The city has seen high levels of drug abuse over the years and Ed meets the locals who are living with the effects of it daily. A young man who got hooked on cocaine aged just 14 nearly died of an overdose. Thanks to rehab and the support of his family, he's swapped cocaine for boxing and is enroute to becoming a professional athlete

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Medical photographer Lorraine Rimmer hosts the final dinner party in west Lancashire, and hopes to impress her guests with a menu consisting of authentic Spanish cuisine, before the winner of the 1,000 prize is announced

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Straight-talking Mel and partner Patrick host night one in the north-east Lincolnshire town of Grimsby with a traditional menu, followed by seasoned ravers Amber and Ryan. Their goat's cheese starter is not to everyone's taste on the second evening, and tensions run high on the final night as hosts Vanessa and Steve won't take any rudeness from Mel. It's not long before sparks fly around the table

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Presenter Sara Damergi goes house-hunting on Spain's Costa Blanca for Viv and Steve Jenkins, who have a budget of 130,000 and want a property they can use for holidays and their eventual retirement

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin and Jasmine Harman help a couple who spend every summer apart due to work commitments search for properties in Brighton and Cadiz. A Spanish property would allow Cheryl and Andy to spend their winters together in a warmer climate, but one of the house-hunters proves to be especially selective about their potential purchase

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Before they met, John and Liz had visited Gran Canaria separately for many years. Five years ago, they were introduced to each other in the town of Puerto Rico. Now, with retirement on the horizon, they wish to settle down to life in a new holiday home that one day could become their permanent home. Ben Hillman tracks down five properties within their budget of 140,000, hoping that at least one will find favour with the couple

programme.title: Sarah Beeny's New Country Lives
programme.desc: Jodie wants to start a small horse livery business and also explores how to start up a kids' club on her family's smallholding. Sarah Beeny follows her progress

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Gemma Longworth's restorations include a 1947 Harley-Davidson and a redundant aeroplane seat

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Glamorous pensioner Val Slater hosts the first party in east Cheshire, where her diners are a radio DJ, a mother, a garage servicing manager and a party girl. She hopes to impress her guests with a Middle Eastern banquet and a course of belly dancing

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Hazel Ardern throws the second party in east Cheshire, and hopes her skills as a hostess, combined with her carefully selected menu, will be enough to secure victory. However, she has a struggle on her hands in the form of fellow diner Michelle Kenworthy, who made sure everyone knew she disliked the food at the previous meal

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The third dinner-party challenge from east Cheshire is hosted by radio DJ Nick Hawkins. His guests have doubts about his beef Wellington, but Nick tries to win them over with some comedy impressions

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Garage servicing manager Michelle Kenworthy hosts the fourth dinner party in east Cheshire. She is confident her food, including deep-fried mushrooms stuffed with duck and orange pate, and a round of bingo for entertainment will win her the 1,000 prize

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Party girl Zoe Miller hosts the final evening in Cheshire, and hopes to impress with a menu that represents all her favourite countries. There is also a selection of hats, disco lights and vodka shots for entertainment, before the winner of the 1,000 prize is announced

programme.title: Five Star Kitchen: Britain's Next Great Chef
programme.desc: The remaining seven chefs are tasked to produce an extravagant dish using the finest ingredients money can buy. Exorbitant price tags and the world's rarest delicacies abound as the chefs compete to appeal to the Langham hotel's millionaire clientele. Those who fail to impress undertake a second challenge in a fight for survival. To prove their business acumen, they must devise a 30 lunch menu and run a busy Langham lunch service. Tension overflows in the kitchen and the chef who brings in the least profit is eliminated. Michel Roux Jr, Ravneet Gill and Mike Reid. judge their efforts

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Lynn is rushed to St George's after collapsing from a brain aneurysm. Her friend Mick tells the story of their lifelong friendship and reveals how she overcame serious health problems with the support of him and his wife. James is treated for a dislocated shoulder, and 30-year-old Lucas has a suspected urinary tract infection

programme.title: 24 Hours in Police Custody
programme.desc: Part one of a two-part special exploring the largest ever unsolved murder case in the history of Cambridgeshire Police, the murder of a six-year-old child in 1994. When a new team takes over, they uncover flaws in the original police work and a compelling new lead

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The stars align for Celebrity Gogglebox as Louis Tomlinson and Liam Payne, Danny and Dani Dyer, Dele Alli and Eric Dier, and Peter Crouch and Abbey Clancy take to their sofas. There's a world exclusive look at the next year's Celebrity Bake Off, and Michael Bubl and James Corden pay tribute to George Michael. Comedy actor Stephen Merchant shows viewers how their donations are put to work, Tom Walker performs his hit single Leave a Light On, and a galaxy of stars - including Backstreet Boys and Rick Astley - throw their weight behind the campaign

programme.title: Shocking Emergency Calls
programme.desc: A family trip to the Cincinnati Zoo turns into chaos and horror as a three-year-old falls into the enclosure of Harambe, the silverback gorilla. A bride's wedding day should be the happiest day of her life, but not for Kelly Ecker. Through frantic emergency calls the domestic abuse she suffers at the hands of her groom is exposed, resulting in a shocking murder-suicide

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The competition comes from in and around Belfast, where the first host is chatty PR manager Claire. She aims to impress with a menu made up of her favourite restaurant dishes, but never having plucked a pheasant before, she has a challenge on her hands. The guests she's hoping to impress are DJ Ryan, joiner and part-time inventor Neil, charity events manager Cailin, and window cleaning manager Paul, on a lively night filled with laughter, music and dancing

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Carpenter Neil hosts the second dinner party in and around Belfast in a bid to win the 1000 prize, presenting good old fashioned, country style cuisine to his guests. With a farmyard full of animals joining in the fun, discussions ranging from disabled chickens to eating stinging nettles and a guest performance from Neil's very own creation, ''head in a jar', it's proves to be a weird and wonderful experience out in the countryside

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Debonair window cleaning business owner and keen golfer Paul has cut a dash already this week in and around Belfast with his sense of style, and now he hopes to impress with his fine food. For Ryan and Neil, most of the fancy fare is uncharted territory, and while Cailin and Claire are impressed with the fine dining, Paul sails close to the wind when he suggests that they might like to be his ladies-in-waiting

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Livewire DJ and events organiser Ryan is the next to host in and around Belfast - and having arranged parties for thousands, is confident he can satisfy four fellow diners. Eccentric joiner Neil anticipates a madcap evening of fun, and with a hipster band playing in the living room, unexpected discoveries in the bedroom and several crises in the kitchen, certainly gets the entertainment he was hoping for

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: On the final night in Belfast, Cailin hosts a Eurovision extravaganza. Her rivals have provided top-notch nosh and entertainment, but she believes that her tried-and-tested dishes from across Europe will land her the top spot

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition begins at the Castle Arms Inn in Snape, North Yorkshire, where owner Jill Chinnery hopes the charms of her 17th-century coaching inn will give her the edge

programme.title: The Great House Giveaway
programme.desc: A banker and a builder join forces to renovate a decrepit family home in Garforth, Leeds. When one of the pair struggles to commit to the work, the pressure rises for the other

programme.title: The Great House Giveaway
programme.desc: Apprentice plumber Peter and factory manager Daniel team up to transform a dated house in Skewen, south Wales, into a dream home - but things start to fall apart from day one

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Jane and Jilly from Brighton look for a holiday home in the Dordogne region of south-west France. Laura Hamilton shows them five suitable properties for their 100,000 budget

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Adrian Simpson meets Colin and Veronica Moore, who want a holiday home in St Lucia where they can escape the British winters, so he searches the Caribbean island for properties on a budget of 200,000

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Cambridgeshire couple Martin and Val Parry seek the aid of Sara Damergi when searching for a retirement property in Mar Menor in southern Spain, with a budget of 200,000

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Sara Damergi helps George and Gillian Pook search for a holiday home and a property they can eventually retire to on Costa Rica's Caribbean coast, and shows them places she hopes will be suitable within their 100,000 budget

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Jean Johansson goes house-hunting around the coastal town of Olbia on Sardinia with outdoor sports enthusiasts Katrina and Colin. They've been coming to the island for 18 years and would ideally love a holiday home big enough for them and their three grown-up children to enjoy. With a budget of 135,000, they're hoping Jean can find them perfection, and she's ready for action lining up five great options for the pair to consider

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Jo and DP are looking for a holiday home in Nerja on Spain's ever-popular Costa del Sol that they can escape to in the winter and rent out in the summer to support them in their retirement. Ben Hillman lines up five options for the pair to consider

programme.title: The Dog House
programme.desc: Documentary set inside Woodgreen animal charity, following efforts to match dogs with new owners. Nine-year-old Rohan meets Patterdale terrier puppy Friday, but there are concerns that the hound may be just a bit too enthusiastic for the youngster. Rocco the Jack Russell has been struggling to find a home, though his bouncy exuberance and love of a good face lick means he could be the perfect match for Zach, who is looking for a dog not fazed by his Tourette's. Grant the stray westie has seen some tough times, but his luck might be about to change with the arrival of Casper and Sid

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud returns to Somerset to see Ed and Vicky Versluys and their cowshed conversion. A year after his last visit and with the house finally complete, Kevin finds out what it's like living in an off-grid home designed for animals

programme.title: Married to a Psychopath
programme.desc: Part two of two. The covert investigation into Malcolm Webster in light of evidence that he attempted to kill his second wife in similar circumstances to his first wife's death over a decade before. As Webster targets his third victim, a wealthy nurse whom he plans to bigamously marry, time is running out for the investigating officers as they learn that the bride and groom will be honeymooning aboard a yacht sailing into international water

programme.desc: Return of the show in which the well-to-do find out what life is like for the less privileged. Horse-loving Ellie learns about living on a budget with a family of six

programme.title: Bargain-Loving Brits in the Sun
programme.desc: Nigel, who moved to Spain in 2015, is known as the 'Benidorm TikTok Guide'. Going live twice a day, he gives viewers an online guided tour of the area

programme.title: 100 Toddler Tantrums Caught on Camera
programme.desc: Some of the most epic toddler huffs found online. The programme reveals and reviews the wild side of child-rearing, with strong-willed kids being wily, loud and funny

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: In North Yorkshire, officers are out in force protecting lorry drivers and their cargoes as organised gangs target goods and trucks travelling through the county. Near York, when a suspicious empty lorry is spotted on an industrial estate, police believe it's being used to transport stolen goods from another vehicle. On the outskirts of Leeds, a police helicopter is called in to help search for suspected fuel thieves hiding out in the woods after fleeing from an abandoned stolen car packed with more than 20 empty barrels ready to be filled with diesel

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: A busy bank holiday weekend for North Yorkshire's officers sees a day trip to Scarborough turn into a high-speed pursuit, and for two young women caught up in the chase, it's an unexpected nightmare. A desperate suspect on a potentially stolen motorbike puts lives at risk when a passenger falls off as police close in for a stop. On the outskirts of York, a suspected drink-driver crashes at speed into multiple vehicles, while a young driver appears to be in denial when he blows almost twice the drink drive limit at the roadside and asks officers to call his mum to prove he doesn't drink alcohol

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Tim and Tom team up with Merseyside police to carry out a raid on a house in Liverpool, Jim wrestles with an aggressive driver, and officers armed with Tasers respond to an alleged assault with a meat cleaver. Plus, Dicko is called upon when a young man is stabbed in a street brawl

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Dog handler Bob hunts down a suspected knifeman, while interceptors Jon and Chris are on the trail of some suspected armed robbers. Meanwhile, Sergeant John wrestles with a drunken reveller, and a tattoo provides a clue that leads Jim to a major drugs bust

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Jenno joins the takedown of a man suspected to be armed, while Dan and Gordy hit the door of a suspected drug den. programme.title: Extreme Dinosaurs
programme.desc: 65 Million years ago, Dinosaurs disappeared. Now they're Back! T-Bone, Spike, Bullzeye, and Stegz. Four prehistoric dinosaurs, evolved into intelligent beings reawaken in a bizarre new world

programme.title: Kong: The Animated Series

programme.title: Department S
programme.desc: The detectives step in when an eminent economist is visited by the ghost of his wife

programme.title: Wild Britain with Ray Mears
programme.desc: The survival expert travels along the south coast of the Isle of Wight. He visits a shipwreck that has become a natural habitat for marine species such as the conger eel and spiny spider crab, and with the help of a local angler goes in search of smooth-hound sharks. Back on dry land, Ray finds out how the preserved footprints of an iguanodon reveal the way the dinosaur walked, observes a colony of ravens, and is introduced to the rare Glanville fritillary butterfly

programme.title: Wild Britain with Ray Mears
programme.desc: The survival expert explores the Isles of Scilly off the Cornish coast, where mild temperatures create an ideal habitat for species of wildlife normally associated with warmer climes. Exotic plants like the South African Hottentot fig thrive in the area, while an abundance of insects, including the rare red-barbed ant, means that migrant birds such as barn swallows use the islands as a source of sustenance

programme.title: The World's Most Incredible Hotels
programme.desc: The most extraordinary, iconic, and luxurious hotels ever built, taking in 26 destinations across 18 countries

programme.title: William and Mary
programme.desc: As the couple excitedly prepare for their wedding, Molly plans a special surprise by having Mary's estranged father attend the ceremony - but soon regrets her actions when the alcoholic sea-dog turns up in a drunken stupor. But that's just the first in a series of hiccups, as Reuben bursts into the church claiming Mary had already married him in Las Vegas. The blushing bride escapes from the ceremony, but William is hot on her heels - little suspecting the biggest shock is yet to come. Comedy drama, starring Martin Clunes and Julie Graham

programme.title: Seize the Day (1986)
programme.desc: An honest salesman fallen on hard times return to his New York roots and a reunion with his estranged father. Drama, starring Robin Williams and Glenne Headly

programme.title: Miss Annie Rooney (1942)
programme.desc: A poor family rally round to help their daughter get the perfect dress for her wealthy boyfriend's party. Comedy drama, starring Shirley Temple and William Gargan

programme.title: Secrets of London with Mark Monroe
programme.desc: London cabbie Mark Monroe takes you to the hidden and more quirky parts of this amazing city that normally lie undiscovered

programme.title: Ainsley's Gourmet Express
programme.desc: The chef prepares the perfect sushi and peanut pan-fried udon noodles

programme.title: Big City Life
programme.desc: A Londoner is helped in their grief process by an opera singer

programme.title: London Live News
programme.desc: News weather events and the best of the capital's culture. Join us to explore life in London

programme.title: Grand Tours of the Scottish Islands
programme.desc: Paul Murton sets off from Mallaig to explore a group of islands famous for their unusual names - Rum, Muck and Eigg. Along the way, he meets the real 'Lord Muck', visits the dramatic Kinloch Castle and joins the residents of Eigg as they celebrate their community buyout

programme.title: Grand Tours of the Scottish Islands
programme.desc: Paul Murton continues his island-hopping odyssey, setting sail on an island pilgrimage in the footsteps of saints, visiting Lismore, Colonsay and Oronsay. He hears the story of Saint Moluag, who established a monastery on Lismore, joins writer Alexander McCall Smith on his yacht, and uncovers the secrets revealed by a Viking ship burial on Colonsay

programme.title: Kate Humble: Off the Beaten Track
programme.desc: The presenter and her Welsh sheepdog Teg travel from southern Snowdonia to one of the least populated areas in the UK, deep in the Cambrian Mountains. Along the way, Kate experiences a deer cull, loses a herd of cattle on Cadair Idris mountain, meets a family relying on the weather to run its mod-cons, tastes the Dyfi Valley from a glass and discovers the Welsh equivalent of the Amazon rainforest

programme.title: Secrets of London with Mark Monroe
programme.desc: London cabbie Mark Monroe takes you to the hidden and more quirky parts of this amazing city that normally lie undiscovered

programme.title: South Riding
programme.desc: Robert tries to avoid Sarah following their encounter in Manchester - but his emotional turmoil is overshadowed by a lawsuit that could ruin him. Meanwhile, Sarah fights her feelings of humiliation as she searches for a way to get Lydia Holly back into school, and Huggins makes a desperate attempt to recoup his losses. Drama set in rural 1930s Yorkshire, starring Anna Maxwell Martin and David Morrissey

programme.title: Cracks (2009)
programme.desc: A nonconformist teacher at a girls' boarding school in 1930s Britain is an outsider among her colleagues but adored by her pupils. When a Spanish student who also revels in her outsider status arrives, the teacher becomes dangerously fascinated with her, sparking uncontrollable jealousy among the pupils. Drama, starring Eva Green and Juno Temple

programme.title: The Internecine Project (1974)
programme.desc: An economics professor is about to start a prestigious job as a government adviser - but his murky past as an industrial spy threatens his chances. His only way of burying the past is to dispose of his former associates, so he hatches a plan to trick them into murdering one another. Thriller, starring James Coburn, Lee Grant, Harry Andrews and Ian Hendry

programme.title: Roswell Conspiracies
programme.desc: The story of allied intelligence agents who've discovered aliens on Earth who are bent on taking over the world. In response, the agents form a top-secret multinational agency, The Global Alliance

programme.title: Extreme Dinosaurs
programme.desc: 65 Million years ago, Dinosaurs disappeared. Now they're Back! T-Bone, Spike, Bullzeye, and Stegz. Four prehistoric dinosaurs, evolved into intelligent beings reawaken in a bizarre new world

programme.title: Fitzwilly (1967)
programme.desc: A loyal butler helps his impoverished, eccentric employer make donations to her favourite charities by leading a double life as a master criminal. Comedy, with Dick Van Dyke, Edith Evans, Barbara Feldon and Sam Waterston

programme.title: Women of Twilight (1952)
programme.desc: A woman moves into a home for unmarried mothers after her boyfriend is charged with murder, but finds the owner sells her tenants' babies. Drama, with Rene Ray and Freda Jackson

programme.title: Monkey
programme.desc: The pilgrims face danger in a volcanic land prone to earthquakes caused by the constant quarrelling of a catfish demon and a shape-changing demon able to assume any form

programme.title: William and Mary
programme.desc: A routine check-up brings shocking news for Molly, but Kate is delighted to get an interview for a place at Oxford University. William is deeply moved when local vicar John Castlemaigne asks him to arrange the funeral of his own daughter. Mary takes up the cudgels for a blind couple who want a home birth for their first child, in spite of the consultant's advice to keep the mother-to-be in hospital. Martin Clunes and Julie Graham star

programme.title: Muck and Brass
programme.desc: Final episode of the drama, starring Mel Smith as a property developer who manipulates his way through local politics. Originally broadcast in 1982

programme.title: Moonwalkers (2015)
programme.desc: A CIA agent travels to London in 1969 on a mission to recruit Stanley Kubrick to fake a moon landing - but is unable to locate the reclusive film-maker. A seedy rock band manager sees a chance to get rich by passing off his friend as Kubrick, but when the ruse is discovered, they have to actually shoot a fake moon landing. Comedy, starring Rupert Grint and Ron Perlman

programme.title: Winged Creatures (2008)
programme.desc: The survivors of a massacre begin to rethink their outlook on life. A compulsive gambler indulges his addiction even further, feeling he has ultimate proof of his good luck. A waitress neglects her baby, a doctor subjects his wife to unusual treatments and a teenager uses her experience to boost her social standing at school. Drama, starring Kate Beckinsale, Forest Whitaker and Guy Pearce

programme.title: Department S
programme.desc: A crate is stolen from a secure warehouse. When the tins of fish soup inside are found discarded, the team realise something more valuable was hidden in the warehouse - but what it is, where it is now, and who was trying to steal it are a mystery. Guest starring Patrick Mower (Emmerdale) and Ronald Lacey (Raiders of the Lost Ark)

programme.title: Dispatches
programme.desc: In Britain today, 4.1 million children are growing up in poverty. Dispatches spent a year with three children and their families to show what life is really like if there's just not enough money for life's essentials of food, warmth and a place to call home

programme.title: The Mirror Crack'd (1980)
programme.desc: Miss Marple investigates a murder on a film set starring feuding Hollywood stars Marina Rudd and Lola Brewster. When a local woman dies after drinking a poisoned cocktail made for Marina, everyone assumes the actress was the intended victim because she had received death threats. However, the sleuthing spinster is not convinced. Agatha Christie mystery, with Angela Lansbury, Elizabeth Taylor, Kim Novak and Rock Hudson

programme.title: Calamity the Cow (1967)
programme.desc: A farmer's children prepare a cow for a livestock show, but at the last moment, it is stolen by a rival. Children's comedy, starring John Moulder-Brown and Elizabeth Dear

programme.title: The King and Four Queens (1956)
programme.desc: A gambler visits a ranch owned by the mother of four infamous outlaw brothers. He hopes to discover the location of buried treasure stolen by the criminal family, but finds himself fending off the advances of the bandits' seductive wives, all of whom hope to escape their absent husbands and make off with the loot. Western, with Clark Gable, Eleanor Parker and Jo Van Fleet

programme.title: The Family Way (1966)
programme.desc: A Lancashire man's marriage is complicated by his impotence and the difficulties of living in the same house as his overbearing father. Comedy, starring John Mills and Hywel Bennett

programme.title: My Greek Odyssey
programme.desc: Peter Maneas journeys through some of the most spectacular Greek islands, exploring the rich culture, history and food of Greece while meeting the locals and those who live there

programme.title: Plane Crash Recreated
programme.desc: The story of Air France Flight 447, a scheduled passenger flight from Rio de Janeiro to Paris which dramatically vanished over the Atlantic Ocean in June 2009

programme.title: Tender Mercies (1982)
programme.desc: An alcoholic failed country singer wakes up broke and hungover in a tiny Texas motel. Taking a job at the establishment, he ultimately marries the widowed owner and becomes a father figure to her son. However, when the chance to return to his musical career beckons, he is tempted to abandon his new family. Drama, starring an Oscar-winning Robert Duvall alongside Tess Harper and Ellen Barkin

programme.title: Honour (2014)
programme.desc: A Muslim girl is forbidden from seeing her boyfriend by her traditional parents, but she defies them and the couple run away together. The girl's mother feels the family has been dishonoured, and hires a mysterious bounty hunter to track her down and carry out punishment for her disobedience. Thriller, starring Paddy Considine and Aiysha Hart

programme.title: Radio On (1979)
programme.desc: A DJ drives from London to Bristol to investigate his brother's death, encountering a succession of strange people along the way - but his interest in solving the mystery begins to wane as the journey unfolds. Road movie, starring David Beames, Lisa Kreuzer and Sting

programme.title: Pointless Celebrities
programme.desc: Eurovision edition of the quiz. Competing are former Bucks Fizz singers and 1981 winners Cheryl Baker and Mike Nolan; Johnny Logan and Dana, who both won the title for Ireland; and Martin Lee - of 1976 victors Brotherhood of Man - teaming up with Sonia, who came second in 1993 with Better the Devil You Know. The final pair is Chris Cromby and Gemma Abbey, who as Jemini scored nul points in 2003. Can they redeem themselves tonight? Alexander Armstrong asks the questions, while Richard Osman is the one with the answers

programme.title: Strike It Lucky
programme.desc: Michael Barrymore hosts the madcap game show, in which three teams of two prove seek to progress along a board game-style path by answering questions. Each duo are allowed to determine how many spaces they would like to move by answering the corresponding number of questions. Landing on a space reveals it's hidden contents, which could amount to a prize, or a 'hot spot', which causes contestants to forfeit their gathered winnings

programme.title: Pointless Celebrities
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong hosts an edition featuring contestants with links to the famous football tournament. The pairs are English World Cup-winning duo Geoff Hurst and George Cohen, Peter Shilton and Steve Bull, who both represented England in 1990's tournament, former footballer Graeme Le Saux and commentator Jonathan Pearce, and Hope Powell and Casey Stoney, representing the women's game. All are trying to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show and win big for their chosen charities. Richard Osman co-hosts

Live coverage of the first day of the First Test in the five-match series from Edgbaston, Birmingham, as England try to regain the Ashes for the first time since 2015. That series included the famous Headingley Test, when Ben Stokes' monumental 135 not out led England to a one-wicket victory
